name: Guest suite in Tanunda · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
The Fechner Place guest suite is located only minutes from some of the Barossa Valley's finest restaurants and Cellar Doors, and only a 15 min walk to Tanunda's main street. There are many restaurants and Cellar doors within a 25 minute stroll.

The space
The Fechner Place guest suite is a small contemporary space, beautifully furnished for a relaxing and comfortable stay. The Queen Bed has been fitted with all natural fibre quality bed linens. The adjoining en suite bathroom has environmentally sustainable shampoo, conditioner, body wash and soap. The open layout includes a kitchenette with microwave, coffee machine, kettle, fridge, toaster and breakfast area. Teas, milk, butter, sugar, coffee, juices, fresh fruit, cheese, locally made bread, biscuits and conserves are provided complimentary. The area comes with a flat screen television. The modern bathroom has good quality towels, bath mat, hand towels, tissues, toilet paper, hairdryer and straightening Iron.
neighborhood_overview:
The studio is located on a lovely quiet street, with its own private entrance and parking. Located in the heart of the Barossa and walking distance to the main street of Tanunda, you are perfectly positioned for easy access to many of the great wineries, restaurants and experiences that the region has to offer.

We are a 2 min drive from the pretty village of Tanunda that is well serviced with a varied selection of cafes, restaurants, pubs, 2 breweries, supermarket, butcher, bakeries, specialty retail stores, a medical centre, hospital and post office for your convenience.

We are a short 10 min drive to the famed Barossa Valley Farmers market in the picturesque township of Angaston, which is open on Saturday mornings from 7.30am. This is on our must do list.

If food and wine are not your thing, there are numerous walking and cycling trails with some easy bush walks through Kaiser Stuhl National Park. This is best visited at dusk to do som
host_about:
I've lived with my partner and 3 gorgeous children in the Beautiful Barossa Valley, South Australia for over 40 years. We enjoy spending time outdoors with our family on our 30 acre property.
We have both worked in the wine and Tourism Industry for the last 20 years and understand the importance of great guest experiences. We have travelled extensively and experienced all types of accommodation.  I have been able to use what I have learnt to create a very successful Airbnb business (Your Home Anywhere).
I have a keen interest and passion in real estate and travel and now enjoy combining both by hosting properties through Airbnb. We love creating beautiful, comfortable spaces that our guests can call "home" and pride ourselves in offering a 5 star service. Our aim is that our guests never want to leave!
Guests can contact Karina at Your Home Anywhere on: 0422 390 791

name: Guest suite in Angaston · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley within the beautiful township of Angaston. Our Self Contained Studio gives your privacy with views of Angastons Hills. The Studio has it's own Kitchenette, ensuite bathroom and a small bunk bed room for two kids*. On the exterior guests have full use of the guest BBQ.

We are located a short 800m walk along a the beautiful trail into Angaston township. Nearby are many restaurants, cafes, wineries.

*Note lower bunk is rated to 120kg and upper 80kg

The space
The studio is the bottom level of our two story property. You will have full and private access to the bottom level which can only be accessed through the main door.

Due to us living upstairs, there may be some slight noise but we endeavour to keep it as quiet as possible.

Outside features beautiful gardens and views, a bench to take it all in and a BBQ area to enjoy our gardens and entertain yourselves if you wish.
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is a beautiful picturesque town located in the Barossa Valley. Within the town there are services such as a butcher, supermarket, pubs, cafes,  restaurants, barossa cheese company and many more other attractions.
host_about: I am married to my beautiful wife and live in the stunning barossa valley. While working in the wine industry we also host our studio through airbnb. I love to travel, having been to around 40 countries and all 6 continents (not antartica). The experiences travelling brings is second to none, food, culture, adventure, architecture. From travelling we have stayed in a mix bag of accommodations, local homestay, villages, to high end hotels. Meeting and greeting people all over the world has enticed us to start out own studio and airbnb on our property in the beautiful township of Angaston in the Barossa Valley.

Our Barossa holiday retreat 'The Acre' is a mere 2 minute drive (or 15 minute walk) from the town centre of the Barossa's quintessential heartbeat, Tanunda.

The space
Recently renovated from the ground up 'The Acre' is a purpose-built holiday retreat. The dwelling sits on an acre block of land, hence the name. As our guests, you will have exclusive access to the first quarter of the block, encapsulated by fencing which provides a compound around the house to allow both you, and our neighbours, each thei
neighborhood_overview:
So close to the town centre yet far enough away for peace and quiet.

Just a 2 minute stroll down the road is Discovery Parks Barossa Valley. The family section of the park includes a splashtacular waterpark, complete with three slides, gigantic tipping bucket and more splash zones than we can count. (day passes available for $15, family and group pricing available on request).

And while the kids are playing in the water the folks can pop across the road to Barossa Valley Brewing. The brewery houses a Brasserie and stunning beer garden with live music from 4 - 7pm every Saturday and Sunday.

These are just two of the many cafés, galleries, museums and within walking distance, and dotted around the main street of Tanunda.

name: Guest suite in Springton · ★4.97 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Meander Retreat is a small rural property near Eden Valley in the Barossa region, amid vineyards and open pastures. The Green Room is full of comfort with a luxury bathroom, lounge, King bed and beautiful rural view. You can sit or hammock in the olive grove, wander the gardens or mixed orchard to write, paint or just daydream. Meander will make you meander, change your plans, sleep long and sweet, and just untangle.

The space
The spacious and sunny guest studio has a king bed, single sofa bed, a fully equipped kitchen and palatial bathroom. There is car parking directly alongside the studio so you have easy access to the private entrance (where you can arrive at any hour and let yourself in via a passcode). The studio has natural cross-ventilation and a ceiling fan, but also has RC air-conditioning for year round comfort. Artists and writers will find this the perfect spot for their creativity and those feeling less inspired can binge on books or Netflix.
neighborhood_overview: The Eden Valley is the higher altitude section of the Barossa Region, which produces world class cool climate wines, but it is also a peaceful and less populated area, so it is perfect for just relaxing and unwinding.   There are vineyards and a few cellar doors nearby but there are many more 20 minutes away down in the valley itself. Springton is 2 kms away and has a general store and a pub.  Nearest supermarkets are  20 mins away.

name: Villa in Marananga · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Located in the heart of iconic Seppeltsfield Road, The Villas - Barossa provide the perfect home for exploring the nearby cellar doors, premium dining experiences and gin distillery and for walking or cycling in the stunning natural environment. Comfy lounge, French linen sheets, soak tub - inside, The Villas provide a relaxed, intimate space. The beautiful natural landscape integrates seamlessly with the restful interiors of The Villas, offering a true bush retreat.

The space
The Villas offer beautiful, environmentally sensitive accommodation in a striking bush setting. Reflecting the region's agricultural roots, The Villas harmonise unique architectural design with simplicity and warmth, creating a peaceful, secluded Barossa retreat.

Comfy lounge, French linen sheets, soak tub - inside, The Villas provide a relaxed, intimate space. The decision will be hard to make - explore all that the Barossa has to offer, or curl up with a book, take time to
neighborhood_overview:
Marananga is a delight to explore, set amongst beautiful rolling hills and vineyards. The village is home to numerous cellar doors, five within an easy walk of The Villas. The award-winning Seppeltsfield Road Distillers are our near neighbours, and the renowned restaurant Appellation at The Louise is also within walking distance.

A drive along Seppeltsfield Road's iconic avenue of palms will wind you through the vineyards of the western Barossa with its well-known wine brands and intriguing small batch wine producers. Historic Seppeltsfield Estate is home to Seppeltsfield Winery, Vasse Virgin, Jam Factory Art & Design Studios and Fino restaurant. Just around the corner you'll discover Hentley Farm Cellar Door & Restaurant.

If you're looking for some adventure, try ballooning or a Segway, helicopter or trike tour. Or maybe a sunset cruise in a Mustang?

Beyond Seppeltsfield Road, the Barossa is a wonderful playground. More than 170 wineries, with

name: Cottage in Penrice · ★4.94 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
description:
Strothers Farm House *** Renovated 2018 *** SELF-CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION - *booking fee included *
The 100-year-old stone house is set on a hilltop on the outskirts of Angaston.
Is ideal if you’re looking to escape for a Romantic Getaway or share with a group of friends. This is the perfect house as a base while exploring the Barossa Valley or relaxing in the peace and quiet.

The space
Strothers Farm House features 3 spacious queen-sized Bedrooms. Included a full Kitchen/Dining, a luxurious Bathroom with a Walk-in shower and Spa Bath, separate Toilet and Wet area. Heating and cooling are catered for with a combustion heater and fully ducted air-conditioning throughout the home. Generous provisions will be provided for breakfast for the first morning of your stay.

Guest access
Access – We have a key safe on the property, so access is easy.
We can be contacted on the phone or via email.
Shops are just a short drive away,
neighborhood_overview:
HISTORY
The property is set on 20 acres and was originally set-up as part of the Soldier Settlement Scheme in 1920 by Leslie George Strother (a returned WW1 Soldier). It has had a couple of owners throughout its time including Alan’s Grandparents, and Parents who both farmed the property. Today the property is mainly used for grazing Sheep.
host_about: I'm a non drinker that Worked in the Wine industry for over 20 years before retiring. Enjoy holidaying, camping.

name: Farm stay in Springton · ★4.85 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
A 2-Storyed, 3-bedroom country home, a 170-acre getaway that's exclusively yours, ideal for that special alone or to be enjoyed with friends. The perfect location to stay whilst exploring the many wineries & restaurants set amidst the natural beauty of this world-famous area. High in the Barossa Ranges, only one hour's drive through scenic hills from Adelaide CBD. Birdwatching/ Bushwalking on your doorstep. Extensive marked trails with abundant wildlife. A total experience-not just another B&B.

The space
Fully Equipped Kitchen & Dining, Lush Bedding, Electric Blankets, Fireplace, BBQ, Outdoor Dining, Marked Walking Trails, Day-Cabin by Lake, Abundant Wildlife and Birdwatching Opportunities

Guest access
Country Home & 170acres - Exclusivley Yours !

Other things to note
2 night minimum stay
neighborhood_overview: Located a short drive to the abundant selection of wineries and restaurants set amongst the spectacular natural beauty of the Barossa.
host_about:
We are a family-operated/ father-daughter team!
We love wine, time spent in nature, our kids/grandkids and the Barossa of course!!

description:
The Loft is a beautiful 2 storey apartment with loft ceilings, renovated to host visitors in the Barossa Valley. The space is light and clean, furnished with modern neutrals and natural textures. All amenities are either organic, locally grown or made.
Located centrally in Tanunda, you are at walking distance to some of the best cafes, restaurants and local shopping in the Barossa.

The space
The 2-storey apartment has been beautifully furnished for a relaxing and comfortable stay. Upstairs has 2 bedrooms, one king bed and one queen bed both with natural linen and cotton bedding. The bathroom features a large rose shower head and environmentally sustainable shampoo, conditioner, body wash and soap complimentary. Also located upstairs is a toilet and laundry. The open layout downstairs includes a large kitchen with induction cooktop, dishwasher, microwave, coffee machine, kettle, fridge, toaster and large breakfast bar area. Organic teas, milk, eggs, butter,
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is one of only 4 located on a lovely quiet street, with its own private entrance and parking. Located in the heart of the Barossa and walking distance to the main street of Tanunda, you are perfectly positioned for great access to all the great wineries, restaurants and experiences that the region has to offer.

The best of the Barossa is right on your doorstep. Your tour can include world-class wineries, fine dining, intriguing heritage, gourmet produce, sweeping vineyard views and unique experiences.

Our sophisticated and charming self-contained accommodation caters for between 2 and 6 people making it perfect for a romantic getaway or a memorable holiday for close friends.

You will have exclusive access to the property. In light of the Covid-19 Pandemic we can certainly resonate with the uncertainty that travellers are feeling. We are taking extra precautions in our cleaning regime on top of the absolute thorough
neighborhood_overview:
The perfect location to explore the Western Ridge of The Barossa. In Greenock you have
-Wine & Craft Beer Tastings at * Murray Street Vineyards * Kalleske Wines * Dell'uva Wines * Ballycroft * Schluter Wines * Greenock Brewery
-Dining at * El Estanco & * The Greenock
-The perfect village to undertake the Greenock Historical Village Walk
-Hire a bike and explore the greater region
-Visit the world-renowned Seppeltsfield Winery (only a 5 minute drive from The Clyde)
host_about: Janine currently runs her own beautiful 5 star reviewed bed and breakfast in the quaint village of Greenock along with managing the stunning Benbullen Retreat in the heart of The Barossa. name: Guesthouse in Light Pass · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Welcome Back! With strict adherence to COVID safe best practices, we’re delighted to once more be open for guests.

‘In The Vines’ Guest Cottage, nestled among long-views of vineyards, villages & church spires. Fully appointed, our private accommodation is ideally placed to explore all that is The Barossa.

Minutes from the Barossa Farmers Market, cellar doors, galleries, cafes & award winning restaurants. Perfect for that romantic getaway, or quiet enough to focus on your business plans.

The space
After a lifetime of traveling ourselves, we settled in the Barossa Valley, bought a beautiful house with a vineyard, and renovated our guest cottage.

'In The Vines' Guest Cottage has a fully equipped kitchen, queen sized bedroom with luxury linens, cosy lounge dining area, modern bathroom with walk in monsoon shower, a laundry and free WiFi.

We offer you cheese and biscuits to match with the wines you've discovered, great br
neighborhood_overview:
The famous weekly Barossa Farmers Market is just a kilometre away, open every Saturday morning - amazing produce, you'll also make friends in the short queue for a superb coffee.

Just across from the market is the award winning Vintners Restaurant, and we are situated not far from the four main villages of Angaston, Nuriootpa, Tanunda and Greenock. From ice creams, handcrafts, boutiques and pubs, we can recommend something to suit your preferences.

Likewise, cellar-door tours, balloon flights and more can easily be arranged, all picking up from your cottage.

Or just lay in one of our hammocks with a great bottle of wine and a book, we can supply most of your needs until sundown. We want you to become another returning guest, looking forward to your next stay with us - Your home from home, 'In The Vines'.
host_about: Andrew and I are an easygoing couple, enjoying our life out in the country where we grow grapes, tend our fruit trees, and enjoy mixing within the local community spirit that is country Australia. Let us introduce you to some new friends too!

description:
At Ten on French you can enjoy modern style living with all amenities. Features include separate lounge, fully equipped self catering kitchen and dining room, Smart TV, air-con, gas ‘log fire’ heating. There are 3 bedrooms, two with queen beds and one single bed with quality linen and quilts. The bathroom has lush towels and modern vanity and shower. Outdoors there is undercover parking, a barbecue/outdoor entertaining area.
There is so much to enjoy within walking distance.

The space
Ten on French offers modern private self-contained accommodation. There is a light-filled fully equipped kitchen and laundry facilities . Ceiling fans and reverse-cycle air-conditioning ensures year-round comfort.
The outside space with bbq is available or sit on the back porch with a wine and enjoy the birds.

Guest access
Self check-in anytime after 2pm. Instructions will be given a day or two prior to check in date. Check-out by 10am

S
neighborhood_overview: An easy 4minute walk through the tree lined street to the historic township of Angaston. Stroll the main street, you’ll find some of the best food in the Barossa as well bakeries, cheese shop, hotels, restaurants, wine bars, and more. On Saturday mornings the local harvesters market sells fresh produce, you can enjoy your local produce breakfast sitting on the hay bales.
host_about: Love to travel: fav places are Okavango Delta, Morocco and Alaska. Also love to read, you will find lots of books in the BnB looking for a reader!

description:
The JHA Stone Cellar is a blend of old and new with thick stone walls and large glass windows for wonderful farm views.

2 king bedrooms, both with en-suite bathroom, (1 bedroom splits to two king singles if required), large living area, butlers pantry, mud room and 3rd toilet.
An out door shower, under floor heating, air-conditioning and quality fittings through out giving our guests an exceptionally relaxed experience.

The space
The J.H.A. Stone Cellar is a purpose built refurbishment of one of the oldest remaining stone buildings on the property. Sitting on a gentle slope in the north west corner of the farm, looking over the old vine Shiraz vineyard, this two bedroom premium accommodation is the ultimate escape.

Guest access
Enhance your stay by cooking yourself a paddock to plate meal. We produce a range of seasonally available produce including: our premium wine, ethically grown lamb and chutneys/preserves. Pre order i

description:
Situated at the home of Tomfoolery Wines in the Barossa Valley, this newly renovated cottage is only about an hours drive north of Adelaide.
Located on the 20 acre winery property it is complete with all of the luxuries to enjoy your time away, including a king sized bed, a large spa, robes, Sheridan towels, wine and a full lounge area to relax in.

The space
Guests are able to walk through the vineyard and stroll through the orchard where they can help themselves to fresh fruit and veggies - season dependent. Also if you visit during the harvest season you are welcome to visit the team at the winery and see the production in full swing, we may even get you to lend a hand.

A two night stay has generous inclusions such as free wi-fi, Nespresso Machine, beer, wines, cheese, local muesli, bacon & eggs, juice, Molten Brown and Vasse Virgin amenities, Robes & Slippers, Netflix and much more.

There is also an indoor pool which is exclusively f
neighborhood_overview:
The Farmers' Market which opens every Saturday morning is just up the road so you can explore all the local produce the Barossa has to offer and top up on fresh supplies.

The three major towns of the Barossa Valley are all located within 10 minutes of the cottage and there are many other wineries and a variety of restaurants close by making it a fabulous location for a wine region getaway.
host_about:
Hi - I am Sarah. A Mum of 2 who is passionate about making sure our guests have the best stay every time.
We also own and operate a boutique winery in the beautiful Barossa. And we love what we do!

description:
Gundaroo retreat is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley and set on 50 acres of picturesque land with rolling farmland, trees and hills. Perfect for a romantic getaway or a girls weekend away. The cottage is set in a scenic location and provides a pleasing blend of rustic charm with modern conveniences. It has 2 bedrooms with queen size beds a cosy wood fire and a lovely deck to relax and enjoy your morning coffee. We provide breakfast provisions for the first day of bacon, eggs.

The space
The cottage is attached to the main house and separated by an outdoor entertaining area. We are a working alpaca farm and will sometimes be working on the tractor or in the garden. You are more than welcome to wander around the garden and go up to the fence to see the alpacas.
We also provide bacon, eggs and milk.

Guest access
Guests have their own private entrance.
neighborhood_overview: There are so many places to visit that are quite close to us.  Birdwood with the motor museum is 5 minutes drive away, Gumeracha with the big rocking horse and wildlife park is 10 minutes.  If you like fishing or kayaking, the Williamstown reservoir is less than 10 minutes down the road.  There is also the Lavender farm at Williamstown and the wineries at Lyndoch are about 20 minutes away.  If you enjoy walking, Mt Crawford forest is also less than 10 minutes away.  There are some beautiful cafes  and local pubs in all of the towns that are close by.  Tanunda wineries are approx 30 minutes away and also the Barossa valley Chocolate Company.  Mount Pleasant is approx 5 minutes away, so if you are going to a horse show we are close by if you want to stay.  Monarto zoo is also approx 40 minutes away.
host_about: I am a mortgage broker and my husband is a carpenter.  We enjoy renovating houses and are renting this one out for the first time as a bnb.  We own an alpaca farm in Cromer, where you can pat and walk the animals, we currently have approx 15 alpacas on the farm.  We have 3 grown children and 2 dogs.  We also enjoy travelling.

name: Cottage in Lyndoch · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
description:
A characterful ironstone cottage located in the heart of the Barossa. Equipped with all the modern amenities for the most discerning guest. The interior is a mix of contemporary and old to give the cottage a light, bright and airy feel while remaining true to it’s longstanding heritage. Situated on a large block, the garden wraps around the cottage to provide many places in which to relax and unwind.

The space
This beautiful ironstone cottage built in the mid 1860’s is located in Lyndoch; a quaint and historic town situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley. The cottage has been newly renovated with a fresh, modern interior, but is also sympathetic to it’s historical roots with the incorporation of lovely antique pieces sourced from the Barossa and Adelaide Hills.

It features all the modern amenities, including a fully equiped kitchen, laundry area with washing machine, split system air conditioning, electric fireplace, large two person spa bath, Wi-F
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is quiet and full of friendly people who always seem to be willing to stop for a chat. The lyndoch hotel is a short 15 minute walk down the road. If you prefer a glass of wine over a beer however, the lovely Reis Creek cellar door is situated just opposite. Lyndoch is a fantastic location as it is central in relation to many wineries and cellar doors. Barossa Chateau, Kies Family Wines, Kellermeister and Chateau Yaldara are all within 5 minutes driving distance of the accomodation. If you are looking to partake in a spot of golf, Sandy Creek Golf Club is a short 5 minute drive, while the Tanunda Pines Golf Club is located only 10 minutes away from the accomodation.
host_about: Brooke & Peter are Barossa Valley locals. Peter was born in Queensland and moved to South Australia to pursue a career in winemaking. Brooke is a born and bred Barossan who recently traded in her career in the wine industry to become a full time Airbnb host.

name: Cottage in Krondorf · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Situated on beautiful Krondorf Road, only three minutes from Tanunda, The Kirche offers a tranquil setting for either a long term or short term stay in the famous Barossa Valley.

This unique, historical building has been tastefully turned it into superb luxury vineyard accommodation without compromising the wonderful warmth and space evident in its origins.

Kirche is German for church. “The Zum Kripplein Christi” Lutheran Church was the centre of village life from 1864 through to the 1950’s.

The space
The Kirche has two bedrooms, each with king beds, which can be split into two singles upon request.

The kitchen is fully equiped and should have anything you require during your stay.

The bathroom has a soaking tub and double shower. There is underfloor heating in the tiled bathroom area.

There are 3 split system air conditioners within the property. One in the main lounge, one in the kitchen and bedroom 2 up

description:
In the heart of the Barossa! This well appointed home is perfectly located in the centre of Tanunda. Tal Haus is on the main street, and a just a 3 minute stroll to some of the region's finest restaurants and wine bars.

It is an older style home - built in 1928, it is a little piece of Barossa history and a great location to explore all that the region has to offer. Tal Haus offers all the comforts of home - suitable for couples wanting a relaxed getaway or a family who needs some space.

The space
There are two bedrooms with luxury queen beds. The large living space offers dining for up to 6 people and one of the sofas can be converted into a queen bed also.

The kitchen has everything you need, so you can cook up a storm or wander down to one of the local eateries. Full use of laundry facilities, free WiFi and access to Stan Streaming Service so you can watch all the latest television shows and movies.

neighborhood_overview:
Tanunda is in the heart of the Barossa so you can head in all directions and find lots of things to see and do - including some of the world's best food and wine. Some of our favourites that are five minutes walk away include....

Ferment Asian - one of Australia's finest modern Asian. Not only is the food great, the award winning wine list is something to behold - http://www.fermentasian.com.au

Vino Lokal - Wine Bar, Restaurant and Tasting room you can sample some of the region's finest from wine producers. It is the home of Artisans of the Barossa which includes John Duvall, Hobbs of the Barossa, Spinifex, Sons of Eden and Schwarz Wine Co. And the food offerings from the Chef, Ryan Edwards are absolutely sensational. http://www.fermentasian.com.au

Musque - is the epitome of a modern eatery and bar, they have over 500 gins to sample but you can get a decent bottle of local wine, grab a burger or enjoy a more sophisticated dining experience. https:
host_about: I am anArts and Cultural Consultant with my own company Play Your Part.  Married, 2 kids living in the beautiful Barossa Valley.  We are not locals but have lived in the region since 2009 and have gotten to know the place really well.  I am a pretty social person - I love a long lunch, visiting galleries and museums or a day out with friends at the pub but could quite happily spend a day at home in front of the fire.

description:
Welcome to Allawah Barossa, a full 3 bedroom home to enjoy all the beautiful Barossa has to offer, minutes walk to main street.

Allawah offers 2 x king-size rooms, 1 x double room and a new double sofa bed in lounge room. Portacot and high chair available upon request.

We live close by and are more than happy to help with recommendations for your stay. A guest book with local information is also provided to enhance your visit.

The space
We provide breakfast provisions of locally smoked bacon, free-range eggs, crusty Apex bakery loaf, and tomatoes for guests for your first morning's breakfast. There is a gas fireplace in living room, air conditioner and ceiling fans to master bedroom and living room. All linen and towels provided. There is a first aid kit, fire extinguisher and blan
neighborhood_overview: The world-famous Barossa Valley is home to many wineries, restaurants and attractions. Our home Allawah is located 400m from Tanunda's vibrant main street, home to many cafes, restaurants, wine bars and shopping. The visitor information centre is also located here just 400m from our house. We will provide you with an information guide with details of all local services, including personalised recommendations.
host_about: Hi, I work at a local Barossa winery hosting guests on a daily basis. I love meeting new people and showing them all that the beautiful Barossa has to offer. We have travelled to many parts of the world so have a very good understanding of how the thoughtful extras in accommodation make the world of difference to your stay.

name: Guesthouse in Altona · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Uzuri Barossa is a fully self contained guest house with a blend of classic and modern design set on our lush two-acre property a mere 3 minute drive from the quaint little town of Lyndoch, the gateway to the Barossa Valley. It is separate from our main house so you will have full privacy to enjoy our cosy guesthouse.

The name Uzuri means 'beauty' in Swahili, a homage to Kenya where my husband Kipi is from.

The space
At Uzuri Barossa you can relax on your private verandah and sip some local wine or enjoy a delectable cup of tea or coffee.

Take a stroll and wander around our property. We have a variety of young fruit trees, herbs, flowers and there are a lot of established gum trees and cypress pine which attract a number of birds such as the Rainbow Lorikeet, Kookaburra and honeyeaters. You will also be able to meet the kangaroos that hop in and out of our property to graze. Our landscaping is a work in progress so please do bear with us.
neighborhood_overview:
We are just a 13 minute drive to Tanunda the cosmopolitan heart of the Barossa with the best restaurants, entertainment and cellar doors. Award winning winery Kellermeister is just a two minute drive from us. The winery is rated in the top 7% of Australian producers by Australia's acclaimed wine critic, James Halliday.

For those who are a bit more adventurous, the Altona CSR Landcare Reserve which is highly rated on Tripadvisor Australia is located just opposite our property. It has a 6km walking track and is a great place to observe the wildlife and vegetation. Or you could wander down on to the Barossa Trail which is a shared cycling and walking path that goes from the outskirts of Gawler through Lyndoch, Rowland Flat, Tanunda, Nuriootpa to Angaston.
host_about:
I made the tree change with my husband Kipi and our two children in 2017 having lived half my life in Melbourne's hip and busy inner suburbs and the prior half in Malaysia. Now I enjoy a slower paced life surrounded by beautiful nature and amazing people.  

I love cooking and entertaining friends and family around my table. Our little family also enjoys travelling, particularly back to Malaysia and Kenya to visit our big families.

We renovated and converted the run down pottery studio on our property to a charming little guesthouse for our friends and family to stay when they visit us. We are happy to share our slice of paradise with travellers and holidaymakers. Meeting new people is always a pleasure and I look forward to hosting you and making your stay a comfortable and memorable one.

description:
Built in 1860, Devitt on French B&B is a step back to the old charms of yesteryear with the modern amenities that make for the perfect escape to the Barossa Valley. Complete privacy with a magnificent look out from the front verandah for your morning coffee. Ideally set amongst the oldest houses in Angaston shaded by a Silver Ash and an old apple tree, this quiet street is an easy walking distance to the main street coffee shops, wine tasting rooms, popular restaurants, and more.

The space
With style and charm this 2 bedroom luxurious cottage was built in 1860 from marble quarried on site. A fully equipped kitchen that will entice you to become the creative chief.
A collection of antiques including crockery that are to be used and enjoyed during your stay to experience high tea at its best. BBQ facilities available with outdoor fire pit and a bath tub and shower that will exceed all expectations. Breakfast essentials available; Nespresso Delonghi cof
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is known as the Jewel of the Barossa and has many great coffee shops, wine tasting rooms , cellar doors  and restaurants from pizza, Italian cuisine, modern Australian to the Barossa Valley Cheese Company are all a short walk away. Or hire a bike from Angaston Hardware shop to ride the bike tracks of the Barossa or book a Barossa wine tour that can show you the sights and memorable places of the region.

We live in a one acre block of land with a pool, tennis court and large lawned area, We have vineyard on either side of our property so the views are beautiful.

name: Cottage in Greenock · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Escape, Relax, Unwind, Explore.....
Experience all that the Barossa Valley has to offer from your home away from home in this restored heritage cottage located in a charming village.

The space
The cottage is for your exclusive use when you stay. It offers accommodation for up to five guests. There are two bedrooms (one containing a queen bed, the other a double bed and a sofa bed).

The separate lounge room has comfy couches, with television and a selection of DVDs to watch.

The self catering kitchen contains a cooktop, microwave, fridge, tea and coffee making facilities.
The large bathroom contains a 2 person spa with shower over, hand basin and toilet. There is also a washing machine.

Heating and cooling is provided by reverse cycle air conditioning and a combustion heater.

Outdoors, in the fully enclosed rear garden (pets welcome by negotiation) is a gas barbecue with hood, undercover table and seating.

description:
A cozy place centrally located in Tanunda, the heart of Barossa Valley, in a quiet street but only 100 metres from the main street:

- under five minutes walk to the iconic Fermentasian and 1918 restaurants, the popular Z wine bar, Musque restaurant and Vino Lokal as well as the Barossa Tourist Centre,

- easy walking distance to Foodland and Priceline pharmacy,

- 50 metres away from Tanunda Recreational Park,

- 20 minutes walk to Chateau Tanunda and Barossa Museum.

The space
THE SPACE & CONTENTS:

*A clean modern spacious 3 bedroom house with en-suite as well as a bathroom with a separate bath and shower.

*Free WiFi.

*Large screen TV with free NETFLIX and Apple TV.

*Quality linen, towels and toiletries.

*Fully equipped kitchen including dishwasher, coffee machine also washing machine, hair-dryer and iron.

*A secure undercover parking and adjacent free stre
neighborhood_overview:
Elizabeth Street is one of the main streets in Tanunda with beautiful quiet neighbourhood.

The Oval/Recreational Park is just 3min walk away.

We are also a short walking distance to the major attractions of Tanunda (restaurants, cafes, shops, museum, wineries, tourism centre, oval, parks, etc).
host_about:
We live in Tanunda which my husband has called home for 30+ years and we both enjoy music, food, wine, travel, and much more. 

With these passions, we will try our best to make your stay enjoyable in this lovely wine region. 

Cheers,
Lizha* & Geoff

*Lee-sa

name: Farm stay in Bethany · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
This is a two bedroom cottage that we built. It is ideal for couples and small families. The bedrooms are separated by a bathroom and the kitchen/living area is one room. There is a sizeable decking along the front that is perfect for relaxing and gazing across the vineyards to the Barossa ranges.

Guest access
The price quoted is for the use of one bedroom. Should you wish to use both bedrooms you need to add a third person to your booking

Other things to note
This cottage is for accommodation only. No breakfast is provided
neighborhood_overview: We are located out on the vineyards and paddocks but within 2 kms of Tanunda. We are centrally located in the middle of the Barossa Valley.

name: Cottage in Lyndoch · ★4.98 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
description:
Once the Royal Mail Coach House, the Barn has been transformed into contemporary accommodation with style. With original stone feature walls, and floor-to-ceiling windows, and sweeping vineyard views

On arrival you will find the cottage stocked with abundant local breakfast provisions, for you to prepare breakfast at your leisure.

The space
The Barn is ideal for a couple or small group of friends. On the ground floor there is a living area that opens onto a vine-covered outdoor dining area, plus a king-sized bedroom with spacious ensuite. Upstairs, there is another bedroom that opens onto a stunning balcony with panoramic vineyard views, plus an ensuite with spa bath.

name: Rental unit in Angaston · ★4.67 · Studio · 1 private bath
description:
The space
Angaston Vineyards Motel is centrally located in the heart of the Barossa Valley, 2 Km from Angaston, 4 Km from Nuriootpa and 9 Km from Tanunda.

It sits across the road from Vintner's Bar & Grill and the famous Barossa Farmers Market and only 500 metres from Salter's restaurant. The Vineyards Motel offers friendly and professional service and is the perfect base for daily excursions around the Barossa Valley's many cellar doors and other sights.

The Motel has 20 units of various configuration and can take groups up to 52 people. It has a pool area with BBQ facilities overlooking the beautiful Saltram's Vineyards.

Bus Tours to several points of interest can be organised from the reception.

name: Guest suite in Angaston · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Vineyard Views, hidden in the ridges of Menglers Hill near Angaston, on a working-vineyard, delivers everything you need for your next weekend getaway in the Barossa.
With Angaston a five-minute drive in one direction and world class wineries a five-minute drive in another, Vineyard Views has you covered. You can stay in and watch the sunset from the deck with a glass of shiraz, or you can use the peaceful location as a base to visit nearby cellar doors and other Barossa attractions.

The space
The newly renovated suite was once a part of the original homestead. It now features a large bedroom, a modern bathroom and kitchen with (cook top, toaster, coffee machine) perfect for a solo or couple getaway. The suite sits just in front of the family home but has its own access and entrance, giving you privacy during your stay and uninterrupted views of the valley.
So... don’t just take our word for it, that the sunset view from the deck is one of the most sp

name: Cottage in Springton · ★4.77 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
description:
A warm welcome to Eco-cottage, simple but cozy property featuring single bed accommodation, a secluded gem of quietness, ideally located with easy access to Barossa Valley, Adelaide Hills, and Riverland. 50mins scenic drive to Adelaide. Walking distance to the general store and pub.

Please note:
-There is no TV or other entertainment gadgets.
Eliza, the cat, and Joy, lab x, are pretty entertaining & make friends quickly.

-Garden landscaping (based on permaculture principles) is in progress.

The space
Wi-Fi for browsing and emails is available (mobile hotspot) after 6pm on weekdays and 24h over weekends.

The lounge, kitchen, and bathroom are all shared areas, and I'm happy to host you or leave you to your own devices, it's your choice. Additional pillows, blankets, and throws are available for a comfortable stay.

Your stay includes a self-serve breakfast, with a selection of teas and coffee. Please let me know
neighborhood_overview: Springton's famous landmark is Herbig's family tree.
host_about: I am a friendly optimist and peace-loving eco-spirit. Mon-Fri I work in the property industry. After work, I spend a lot of time working in the garden (even more so on the garden), then there are hikes with Joy (my lab pup), cuddles with cat Eli, and I like to read a good non-fiction book.

name: Home in Seppeltsfield · ★4.71 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
description:
Nestled in the Western side of the Barossa, in the scenic town of Seppeltsfield is Triple Creek's Guest House. Luxurious with an authentic country feeling, this is the perfect spot for your next group gathering, family getaway or corporate trip away. Our Guest house comfortably sleeps eight featuring four bedrooms, two bathrooms and two living areas plus an outdoor entertaining area featuring a combination wood-fired pizza oven and firepit our Guest House is an entertainer’s delight.

The space
Our modern and functional guest house is the perfect location for a group getaway. Overlooking the property and the countryside, this house comfortably sleeps 8-10 with four bedrooms, two bathrooms and two living areas. The master bedroom features a spacious ensuite and King sized bed. The remaining bedrooms are comfy and stylish with Queen sized beds and property views. The outdoor entertaining area overlooks the vines featuring a combination gas and wood-fired pizza oven
neighborhood_overview:
Triple Creek is located in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Our property is surrounded by beautiful vineyards, scenic creeks and picturesque rolling hills and with the closest neighbours 500 metres away, the Guest House is an idyllic country escape.

Secluded yet perfectly positioned within a nice walk or short walk to neighbouring wineries / resultants and Cellar Doors

name: Cottage in Tanunda · ★4.98 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
description:
Under the Vines is a self contained cottage in five acres of vineyard and native bushland, in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley.

Peaceful and private, this beautiful accommodation is perfect for couples, small groups and families, and is a lovely base to explore the Barossa region.

Every window has a vineyard view!

The space
The spacious living area - with comfy sofas, beanbag, cushions and snuggly blanket - is set up with complimentary Wi-Fi and Netflix, a large smart TV, PlayStation & Blu-ray DVD.

The main bathroom has a huge double shower and luxurious two-person spa, and a generous selection of towels, earth friendly body and spa products, and flatscreen TV/DVD (viewed from the spa).
Bathroom 2 features a coloured rainshower.

The kitchen has full facilities - oven, cooktop, microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher and coffee machine, and and a great range of regional provisions included for breakfast/brunch
neighborhood_overview:
Easy driving distance to world class wineries and food destinations, quirky cafes, parks, walking and bike trails. Come and explore for yourself!

The Barossa Valley offers many unique and rich experiences - food, wine, culture, heritage. Allow time to immerse yourself in some of these....and then come back again for another bite!

description:
10 Murray St Tanunda is situated in the main street of Tanunda, in the centre of the Barossa Valley. A few doors from the main street enjoy a short and relaxing walk to shops, cafes & award winning restaurants.
10 Murray is a blue stone fronted cottage, built in 1890. The interior has been totally renovated and modernised. With 3 large bedrooms all with king beds and the luxury of an ensuite for each bedroom Stay and feel like a local in our beautiful home you wont want to leave

The space
Wonderful diversity of this property with main setup of bedding being 3 kings, all beds can be changed to offer single bedding. Perfect for a group of friends, family or corporate visitors.
Under floor heating in winter and reverse air conditioning throughout the house makes your stay super comfortable.
We do not supply breakfast provisions as we love the variety of cafes in town and encourage you to explore locally. We do provide a few cooking basics , tea, coffe

name: Guesthouse in Greenock · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
This cute little flat is in walking distance to five wineries , local pub, local shop and restaurant. Disabled friendly with assistance bars either side of the toilet and a very large shower with assistance bar. Would suit Singles, Couples or Couple with one or two small children. Enjoy what the barossa has to offer within a short walk away! Please note this is strictly a Non Smoking accomodation.

The space
1 bedroom flat with queen bed with ensuite, fully functioning kitchen, lounge (also futon for child ) tv. Outdoor patio to enjoy a nice glass of Barossa’s famous Shiraz. There is no smoking allowed on the premises

name: Guesthouse in Mount Pleasant · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
In the township of Mount Pleasant a 5 minute walk to the Saturday morning Farmers Market where you can have coffee and an amazing breakfast, or 10 minutes walk to the hotel. You have the whole granny flat and porch to yourself. Drive in to your reserved parking spot. You then go through to your private area where a lock box code will gain you entry. Inside you will find everything you should need for a comfortable stay.Let me know if you require further details.

The space
You will be able to drive up to your own private parking space. The accomodation was purpose built for owners to live in while house was built. It has everything that you need for a short stay.Your private space is separate from the hosts residence. You have your own porch area to sit and enjoy a drink. Inside there is a kitchenette with electric frypan, toaster and microwave please note there is no oven or cook top. Pantry items such as oil, salt and pepper are available. A wide selection of te
neighborhood_overview: Mount Pleasant is a lovely country town that feels rural however is close to so many wonderful tourist destinations.The famous Farmers Market on every Saturday morning 8am-12pm. Pick up wonderful fresh fruits and vegetables all locally grown.There are cakes, pastries and amazing coffee. The breakfasts are also wonderful with something for everyone. We have one hotel, two bakeries, a lovely quaint book and gift shop in Mount Pleasant all within walking distance. Considered the gateway to the Barossa there are local wineries just ten minutes drive or a 30 minute drive and you will be in the heart of the Barossa, Tanunda and Angaston with countless attractions. Twenty five minutes in another direction and you can be sitting on the banks of the river Murray in the lovely township of Mannum home to the  paddle steamer The Murray Princess.We are also close to the Adelaide hills with many other wineries to enjoy.

name: Cottage in Angaston · ★4.97 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
description:
Our 1940's self-contained cottage is located on the main street, just 5 minutes walk to the shops, cafes and playground.
The backyard has a view of the hills and creek, and creates the perfect backdrop to unwind for a weekend away. The ideal combination of location and country setting.
The cottage has a combination of new linen and bedding, with some beautiful antique touches.
*The cottage is located on the main street so does get some traffic noise during peak hours.

The space
The Cottage has been newly furnished and includes some touches of antique furniture to compliment the cottage's heritage.

The open-plan living, dining and kitchen is a very spacious area, giving everyone enough room to relax. The kitchen island bench creates a social space and plenty of room for those who like to cook up a storm. The kitchen is fully equipped including a microwave, fridge and dishwasher. There is tea and coffee included with some fresh fruit on ar
neighborhood_overview:
There is so much to explore within walking distance; Barossa Valley Cheese company, Wine bar, several cafes and eateries, gift shops, playgrounds and walking paths. Chemist and Foodland is also located down the main street.
You will find information on my other Barossa favourites and towns on arrival, including wineries and walking trails.
The local Barossa Farmers Markets are held every Saturday morning, only 2 minutes drive away.
host_about:
I have lived in the Barossa for over 26 years. I love to call the Barossa home and enjoy sharing knowledge of what our beautiful region has to offer. I have worked in hospitality and the wine industry for 19 years, and customer service is a passion.
I love to explore other regions and have enjoyed several overseas holidays in the last 5 years, staying in several airbnb accommodation.

name: Home in Nuriootpa · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
description:
In the heart of the Barossa, Cirillo Guest House is set in a tranquil and secluded location for the perfect getaway. The house is decorated in bright, clean furnishings. The house sits surrounded by some of the oldest vineyards in the world, planted in 1848 owned and operated by the Cirillo family.
The winery estate offers beautiful views of neighbouring vineyards and creates the perfect backdrop to unwind.

The space
Exclusively yours to enjoy, the provincial / Hamptons styled house offers three bedrooms along with modern open plan living spaces. The huge kitchen is fully equipped with an oven, microwave, fridge/freezer and dishwasher. There is a large island bench for communal dining.
The clean and bright bathroom has a rain shower with a separate second toilet located adjacent to the laundry. The laundry has a washing machine and clothes dryer.

description:
'Mattschoss House' offers a unique place in Barossa Valley's history established in '1890'. Refurbished to reflect it's heritage with clean modern furnishings, a comfortable retreat all year round. Set along the Para River with vineyard views, an array of native birds and the infamous Western Ridge sunsets. Centrally located with great access to some of Barossa's iconic wineries and restaurants, with neighboring wineries just a stones throw from your front door.

The space
Whole house to yourself! With modern comfortable furnishings for you to relax and enjoy your time away. Featuring 3 double bedrooms all with luxury Queen beds, reverse cycle air conditioning throughout, fire place in the dining room, large fully equip country style kitchen with modern appliances. The formal lounge room allows you to soak up the warm sunshine, sink into the large sofa or curl up and watch the large screen TV with a glass of wine. The bathroom hosts heated floors, with a half bath
neighborhood_overview:
Located on the iconic Seppeltsfield Road you are walking distance to neighboring wineries and a short drive to icons like Maggie Beer Farm Shop, Appellation Restaurant, Peter Lehmann Wines, David Franz Wines, and Seppelsfield Winery. The bustling main street of Tanunda is close hosting our Barossa's Tourism hub along with coffee shops, bakeries and retail shops.
On Saturdays you can head to our local Farmer's Market for breakie and meet, taste and explore our finest in produce, baked goods, gin, wine and so much more.
You wont be short of things to do in the Barossa, head to Barossa.com for all the latest. When considering your travel plan at least a few days, there is so much you wont have time to see it all!

name: Farm stay in Williamstown · ★4.90 · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
A well equipped, inclusive and accessible cabin on a 24-acre hobby farm in picturesque Barossa Valley. Inspired by the region's rustic charm, it features reclaimed traditional corrugated iron walls and roof. Cosy yet spacious and comfortable: king-size bed (can be 2 single beds), kitchenette, aircon+ceiling fan. Breakfast provisions. Wheelchair ramp, wide doors. Calming views: vineyard, bushland and gardens. Welcome to people of all abilities & walks of life. Suitable for a couple or 2 friends.

The space
Note 1: The accommodation is suitable for up to 2 adult people only. Parent(s) with infants before crawling/walking stage are welcome. Not suitable for children who are of crawling/walking age as the property is not child-proof.

Note 2: The corrugated iron walls and roof are fully insullated, still it can be noisy during heavy rain - please consider this if you're a light sleeper.

Designed with accessibility, inclusivity, and comfort in mind
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Southern Barossa - offering the best of both the Adelaide Hills and the world-famous Barossa Valley. So much to explore: the wineries, restaurants and cafés, bushwalking and birdwatching in nearby nature reserves, kayaking and fishing at the local water reservoirs, historic sites and cultural events, a swimming pool in Williamstown, farmers markets and so much more ... A pleasant walking trail is just at our northern border - a 20min walk to Williamstown's cafes and shops, in the shade of old gum trees, and you could meet the neighbour's 2 curious alpacas that keep the grass down along the walking path :-)  We have prepared a guidebook and will be happy to suggest some local attractions.
host_about: We are lifelong learners, loving and observing nature and gardens. We like to travel light and visit places with no crowds. We live in the Barossa Valley, South Australia, and have retired from our careers in web management (Nelly) and satellite communications (Stan). Nelly looks after the guest cabin and the gardens, Stan tends our vineyard and makes wine.

name: Barn in Buchfelde · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
This romantic place to stay offers a history all its own.

Come and experience what is believed to be the barn which has been converted into a cozy and private space for two. We have tried to retain as many historic features of the cottage while making sure it is modern and comfortable. We still have a lot to do and will continuing works between guests.

The cottage has a quirky attic bedroom accessed by a steep set of stairs. Very much like a tiny house. Please keep that in mind when booking.

The space
The cottage is located on a rural property on the outskirts of Gawler in Kaurna country.

This property was previously owned by Dr Richard Schomburgk who arrived in South Australia from Germany in 1849. The two brothers bought a property of 81 acres adjoining the Para River in the Gawler area in 1849. The settlement, which they named Buchsfelde and which our property was a part of. name: Home in Lyndoch · ★4.98 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Historic Lyndoch, is less than 1 hour drive from Adelaide CBD. Great place to base yourself for a relaxing food, wine, romantic or family getaway. Extremely comfortable private house with all amenities, in this unique 1850’s colonial building. Price is for 2 guests (no extra cleaning fee). Additional guests (including children) are $25/person/night. Enjoy & entertain at your own Bar in the original Front Bar of the Inn (BYO drinks). Tanunda, Nuriootpa & Angaston are nearby.

The space
This is the main house of the Barossa Inn & Bakery BnB with a romantic king-sized 4 poster bed in the main bedroom. A 5 minute walk to the town centre, with shops, restaurant, hotel and supermarket etc.

The BnB is an entire house with lounge (original 'front bar' of the Inn), kitchen, meals/dining, family, 3 bedrooms, laundry and large backyard.

We provide free wifi. Netflix, Stan and Prime apps are available for guest sign in. There is also a good collection o
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is the 'Gateway' to the Barossa Valley/ The residence gives you local ambience and history whilst providing a touch of luxury (enjoy the wonderful king-sized four poster-bed!). You have the opportunity to explore this vibrant foor and wine region, with the main Barossa towns - Tanunda, Nuriootpa and Angaston, all an easy drive away. Wineries and boutique shopping abounds in the area around the BnB. The bicycle track from Angaston to Gawler and beyond, passes nearby. Our BnB is a great starting point for your cycling adventure.
host_about:
Local Barossa family. Heather & husband Gordon together, offer you this accommodation in one of the historic buildings from the 1850s, in Lyndoch. Lovingly preserved and decorated, we hope our guests will relax and enjoy their stay. We’d be pleased to show you the original bakers oven which served the town for around 60 years. We live nearby and can respond to any requests, or can leave you to enjoy the serenity and luxury of our little piece of paradise!
We enjoy travel ourselves and experiencing AirBnB’s all over the world. Our guests come from all states of Australia, but also from nearly every continent, so it is a great pleasure to host  our guests from all walks of life. 
Enjoy all the Barossa Valley has to offer by basing yourself in Lyndoch with us. We particularly welcome our fellow South Australian residents, to enjoy some local tastes and experiences which are easily accessible, thoroughly delectable and exciting or relaxing - the choice is yours!

description:
Charmaine and Steve are the hosts at Halletts Valley Hideaway - a luxurious self-contained cottage tucked away amidst vineyards on the outskirts of Tanunda, in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley. The property was rebuilt from the ground up in 2017, blending original timber beams and local stone with contemporary design to offer guests a haven of peace and comfort. Enjoy panoramic views of rolling hills, spectacular Barossa sunsets, kangaroos amongst the vines and blue wrens on the lawn.

The space
A rare opportunity to enjoy recently refurbished, high quality accommodation, while experiencing one of the most panoramic views of the Barossa range.

A luxurious blend of rustic and contemporary themes in a secluded location nestled amidst vineyards in the heart of the Barossa.

In the cooler months, enjoy the fabulous Nectre slow combustion heater (kindling and firewood provided).

A generous selection of locally sourced food, dri
neighborhood_overview:
Barossa Wineries…

The Barossa has a winemaking tradition stretching back to 1842 and, having escaped the ravages of the phylloxera virus that decimated many European and Australian vineyards in the nineteenth century, is home to some of the world’s oldest vines still in production. Today, the region is home to more than 150 wineries and 80-plus cellar doors. Whilst producers range from large-scale global operations to small-batch artisans they all retain a distinctly local character and visitors can be assured a warm welcome. The local tourist board provides a comprehensive guide to the region’s wine here. Here’s a few of our favourites (in no particular order):

Artisans of Barossa: a group of eight family-owned winemakers who share a tasting room on Murray Street, Tanunda – Hobbs of Barossa Ranges, John Duval Wines, Sons of Eden, Schwarz Wine Co, Purple Hands Wines, Spinifex, Lienert Vineyards and Chaffey Bros Wine Co.

Izway: a ten-minute drive from

name: Home in Seppeltsfield · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
description:
Set in the vineyards and gardens of Seize the Day wine estate, our three bedroom house offers relaxed, premium accommodation for up to 6 adults in modern country style
Explore, relax, unwind, share good food, wine & company. Walking distance to Hentley Farm, a stone’s throw from Seppeltsfield Winery & many local boutique cellar doors, restaurants, Gin Distillery & other attractions along iconic Seppeltsfield Road, the perfect base for you to enjoy your Barossa experience. *children over 12 only

The space
Recently re-furbished with all new furniture. Plenty of room to move, there are three comfortable bedrooms with brand new beds & crisp fresh Sheridan linens. ( King bed in BR2 can be split in to two singles if required)
A large fully equipped kitchen with plenty of bench space, including new super quiet dishwasher, microwave, pantry supplies, Nespresso Coffee machine, range of teas, large fridge, plus breakfast supplies, local gourmet produce for a g
neighborhood_overview:
Located just off the iconic Seppeltsfield Road.. We are uniquely positioned with the amazing neighbours we have. The Barossa is known for its food, wine, music, heritage and hospitality and along Seppeltsfield Road we offer this in spades!! Apart from our visually beautiful location with vineyards and rolling hills, we are surrounded by boutique cellars doors, three of the Barossa's best restaurants and the iconic winery Seppeltsfield Estate. Here they offer not only bespoke wine tours including tasting a 100 year old Tawny and a heritage winery tour, but also house the acclaimed FINO restaurant, and the Jam Factory studio with artisans in residence. These include a knifemaker, milliner, shoe maker, jewellery makers and potters. You will also find Octeine Coffee Cafe, and Vasse Virgin who make luxe Olive oil body and food products.
Other wineries include Hentley Farm ( which is right next door to us), Izway Wines, Barossa Valley Estate, Two Hands, Greenock Creek Wines, Kalleske
host_about: Introducing people to all of the amazing things the Barossa has to offer is what we love to do.  We love the ever changing culture of the Barossa, the friendly community feel and sharing with guests local knowledge and the best kept secrets of this wonderful region.

description:
Chinner Cottage is located in one on the cutest towns in the Barossa, Angaston. Just a short walk (500m) to the Main Street.

Breakfast provisions are supplied on the first day, however you’ll likely want to explore the nearby cafes such as Otherness, Hive and Casa Carboni. The front yard overlooks the town’s oval and tennis courts.

Both bedrooms have queen beds.

There are 2 couches, both a good size 2 seater.
Dining table sets 5.
Breakfast provisions are supplied for the first morning, there are numerous cafes in Angaston for breakfast too.
While the kitchen is equipped, please note there is NO oven.

Angaston is one of the cutest towns in the Barossa.

There are plenty of wineries to discover - Home to Yalumba and close by are Flaxman, Poonawatta, Hutton Vale and Henschke.

Also home to Barossa Valley Cheese Company, Casa Carboni Cooking School, Otherness Wines and Vintners, a must for lunch or dinner.

On weekends the Doddridge Blacksmith Shop & Museum is open.

name: Cottage in Angaston · ★4.76 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Plum Cottage is a 1940’s miner’s cottage, renovated to ensure all modern conveniences. Everything you need for a getaway to the Barossa.

The space
Enjoy heritage Barossa with all the comforts.

Bedrooms are carpeted, and each furnished with hanging space, a queen bed and extra large quilt.

New kitchen includes gas cooktop, cooking essentials and saucepans – although you also have breakfast, lunch and dinner options just a five minute walk from the front door.

Brand new bathroom with shower and bathtub.

The cottage is on a quiet local street, 5 minutes walk from the main street of Angaston and its shops, supermarket, cafes, bakeries, pubs, restaurants, Casa Carboni cooking school and the Barossa Valley Cheese Company.

Angaston is surrounded by vineyards, fields and gums. Excellent access to Barossa wineries, the Angaston to Nuriootpa cycle track, the undulating hills of Barossa’s high country, our fabulous Barossa Farmer’s market, and the multi award winning Vintners Bar & Grill.

name: Villa in Lyndoch · ★5.0 · 7 bedrooms · 11 beds · 3.5 baths
description:
Lyndoch Grand is located at the gateway to the Barossa Valley and this c1855 heritage-listed property is perfectly suited for large groups. It is fully self-contained with 7 bedrooms, 5 living rooms and 3.5 bathrooms. You'll have exclusive use of the entire house, conveniently located in the heart of Lyndoch village and a short walk to restaurants, wineries, shops and galleries. With space, elegance and natural surrounds, it's the perfect base from which to explore the Barossa region

The space
We've recently purchased this beautiful property, which was originally built as The New Lord Lyndoch Hotel in 1855. Steeped in Barossa Valley heritage it's been used as a hotel, courthouse, council chambers, delicatessen and a coffee palace prior to being faithfully restored as a grand private residence in more recent times. It's ideal for large groups and sleeps 14 people across 7 bedrooms. There's plenty of space to relax in one of the lounge rooms, the magnificent entert
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is one of South Australia's oldest towns and is the gateway to the world famous Barossa Valley, just 56km north of Adelaide. It was the first Barossa town settled and the first vines were planted here. It still retains a quiet village feel, with the local hotel, supermarket, traditional butcher, bakery, library and post office a two minute walk away. Surrounded by vineyards and glorious red gums, Lyndoch is an ideal base for exploring all the Barossa has to offer.
host_about: I'm a self-employed musician and antique dealer. I'm outgoing, energetic and optimistic, with a keen sense of humour. I love my family, socialising with friends, hunting for interesting antique and vintage items and playing music. I enjoy cooking, especially Italian and Mexican food, and don't mind a nice cold beer.

description:
Teresa garden is a beautiful and historical cottage in the heart of the Barossa Valley. It only takes 2 minutes by car to reach Tanunda town.
You'll feel life has slowed down in this comfortable, peaceful, well equipped, quiet, sunny retreat.
Whilst reconnecting with nature, you can also discover Australia's most famous wine-producing region making this an ideal place to stay.
The cottage can accommodate at least 6 people, making it the perfect place for families or groups of friends.

The space
-About Teresa Garden-

A large house overlooking the vineyard.
4 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms which can accommodate 8 people.
Well-established gardens with a fountain to greet you at the turn around driveway.

-Living & dining area-

Large formal dining room seating for 8-10 people.
Formal lounge for quiet reading.
Informal lounge with large TV and 2nd dining room off the kitchen.


-Bedrooms

name: Home in Tanunda · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
description:
A beautiful white sandstone and hand fired red brick Bungalow a short walk to the main street. 3 large bedrooms flow from the main hallway, two with ornate fireplaces & bay windows. The master bedroom is extra-large with a king size bed. Queen size beds in the other 2 bedrooms. The snug room converts to a 4th bedroom, the double sofa converts to comfortable double bed. Both bathrooms have showers, underfloor heating and toilets, one has a bath tub

The space
This beautifully presented white sandstone and red brick bungalow was built in 1935 and is located within walking distance of the main street of Tanunda

The grand entrance to this home is impressive and leads you through the glass door entrance and hallway which is of grand proportions

CCTV is in use external to the house.

name: Barn in Springton · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Be part of Barossa History, and stay in the renovated Hayloft built by the original Herbig family, who used to live in the nearby famous Herbig Family Tree.

The hayloft is a romantic getaway for a couple , with a sofa bed located downstairs (& another upstairs) in the common area if required. (Max 3 people).

Upstairs in the Parisienne bedroom (ceiling fan & split system aircon), there is a beautiful view over the courtyard and ponds.

(Chromecast/wifi for streaming)

Welcome basket provided.

The space
The beauty of The Hayloft is knowing that the Stables cottage is also on the property, should you need extra accommodation for family or friends. A newly upgraded bathroom is downstairs in the hayloft.

Please note that we charge $25 for each extra adult guest, per day, to cover professional linen service, electricity, water and cleaning. ($20 for children 2-12 years old).

Whether you are visiting the
neighborhood_overview:
Checkout where Springton is on a map before booking!

The historic hamlet of Springton, population 600, is located in an amazing location to explore the local area:

The cottages are directly opposite the Edenmae cellar door, for tasting platters and food on Friday, Saturday and Sunday

All the Barossa wineries are within 30 minutes, with the closest being Henschke, Suffield, Eden Hall, Fernfield, Eden Valley, Rileys, Mountadam, etc

A must visit (just 5 mins away) is the Mt Pleasant Farmers Market (every Saturday 8am-12noon) - (Have a wonderful cooked breakfast there) , or you can choose the Barossa Farmers Market in Angaston every Saturday 730 - 1130am.

20 minutes from Historic Angaston, as well as Nuriootpa, Tanunda (go via the Menglers Hill lookout) and Lyndoch.

Take a 1km hike to the beautiful view of the forests and valleys from Mount Pleasant Summit (5 minute drive to trailhead on Glen Devon Rd)

Springt
host_about: As Airbnb hosts (and Airbnb guests when we travel), we want our gests to have the best experience possible. We are sure you will enjoy either the Stables or the Hayloft as much as we do. We bought this beautiful property for our friends and family to enjoy, and when available, for others such as yourselves. If you need a break from the busy city lifestyle, come and relax in our double hammock, on the boat in the billabong, by one of the two firepits, or a night watching the wood heater in the Stables. The sound of the waterfalls, birds, and flowing water in the ponds adds to the relaxed ambience. Our highlight is to know that we have provided a place of tranquility for all our guests.

description:
A beautiful, secluded, self contained cottage in the Barossa Valley overlooking the North Para River. There are many places to walk, picnic or simply enjoy the view. All modern amenities included and sleeps up to 4 people. A couple of minutes away from Chateau Yaldara, the Lyndoch Hill Restaurant and the Lyndoch main street. Only a few minutes more to Tanunda and the other wineries and restaurants in the Barossa Valley.

The space
Unique views and park like surrounds make this a truly relaxing getaway. With virtually no surrounding noise or light sources the days are peaceful and the night sky truly stunning.

Find us at www/riversidefarm/net/au or search for 'Riverside Farm Barossa Valley' on the web.

Guest access
All areas are accessible but please leave things as you find them

Other things to note
This is a working farm so please exercise common sense when moving around the property.

description:
Welcome to 'Little Eden' - a beautiful self contained cottage nestled amongst the gumtrees and wineries of Eden Valley, in the centre of the Barossa Valley.

The cottage is light, clean
and offers a cosy, quiet, yet convenient place to use as your base to explore the stunning region and it's surrounds.
And when you're done exploring, come home, light a fire or take in the cool valley air at night and sink into the couch for a quiet night in with a glass of your latest discoveries.

The space
With your own private bedroom, en-suite bathroom, a kitchen with modern appliances, comfy living room, Aircon , Fire place, WiFi & Netflix, this truly is a great place to escape the hussle-bussle of the city or for a young family to take that long overdue getaway where they can truly relax, enjoy the splendour of the Barossa Valley, and even bring your pet with you.

This cottage is set in a fantastic location and is a gorgeous home-away-f

Mike

name: Cottage in Tanunda · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
Flaxman Cottage is one of three self-contained, connected heritage cottages in historic Goat Square in Tanunda. It features two bedrooms (with king and queen sized beds), spa bath, under-floor heating & a wood fire, and is the perfect place to retreat, relax and enjoy the Barossa Valley. Provisions are left to prepare your own country style breakfasts.

Experience intimate surroundings with thick stone walls, historic low ceilings, quality furnishings & extensive cottage gardens.

The space
Built in the 1850s, Goat Square Cottages are on the Register of the National Estate and represent one of the oldest occupied dwellings in the Barossa Valley. The space has been family owned since 2000, lovingly restored and furnished with modern facilities. As well as quality furnishings and luxurious comfort, other highlights include thoughtfully chosen artworks and fabrics, many of which support Goat Square Cottages’ commitment to sourcing local and regional product
neighborhood_overview: Your cottage is located in the historic heart of Tanunda. In times past, the Ziegenmarkt (Goat Market) was held every Thursday at Goat Square. The cottages are within easy walking distance to the Main Street of Tanunda where the outstanding fermentAsian Restaurant and 1918 Bar and Grill are located, as well as donuts and coffee at Browns Barossa Donuts.

name: Guesthouse in Altona · ★4.71 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Come and enjoy this spacious self-contained home away from home in the heart of the ever-spectacular Barossa Valley, South Australia.

The space
‘Lamberts little paradise’, located 2kms on the outskirt of the historic township of Lyndoch, it is the perfect space to enjoy a get away and unwind from the daily hustle of life.

Lyndoch is located only 1 hours drive from Adelaide via Gawler and Elizabeth and is nestled in the heart of South Australia’s vineyard country.
Within the wine touring country, also enjoy family run cafes’, helicopter sight-seeing tours, local hiking tracks, bike trails, local markets, antique stores and so much more.

What you get -
• A Private Guest Studio - sleeps up to 5 in 2 bedrooms, one with queen and one with a double bunk with a double bed for the lower bunk.
• Cooking facilities
• Washing machine
• Split system reverse cycle
• Open plan living/wheel chair accessible in all areas

name: Place to stay in Kapunda · ★4.90 · 7 bedrooms · 9 beds · 2.5 baths
description:
The Station at Kapunda offers luxury group accommodation for 10 to 14 guests in a unique environment and within a short drive to both the Barossa and Clare Valleys.
Book with confidence. A full refund will be given for any cancellations due to government restrictions.

The space
About the property…
SLEEP TIGHT
5 king bedrooms
Additional 5 single beds.
Please refer to the property plan for the bedroom layout to ensure suitability for your group as some of the rooms are interconnected.

COOK UP A STORM
The original ticket office is now a chefs kitchen with every possible convenience: coffee machine, sandwich press, induction stove, pots & pans, crockery and cutlery for all!

R&R
Relax in the lounge, the courtyard, the little book room, and the kitchen garden. And the platform – at just under 100m long – will give you plenty of space to relax or dine.

WORK or PLAY
The board/games room c
neighborhood_overview:
We think that you'll be surprised at just how much Kapunda has to offer. In addition to being only a short drive to the world renowned wine regions of the Barossa and Clare Valleys, the local area is worth exploring.

Book a tour of ANLABY STATION - a historic sheep station that has been lovingly restored including 20 acres of manicured gardens.
Explore the RETAIL outlets in the main street: homewares at KOCO HOME, plants and pots from PLANT POT & MORE, gifts and more at TINY NEST

ART & CULTURE plays a big role in Kapunda. Wander the streets to look at the award winning street murals and visit the regional gallery to pick up a piece or two.
If you are more serious about your creativity, enrol in a workshop to paint BLOOMS with Jacqueline Coates. You will need to book ahead - and hope that she is in town at the time and not in residence in Paris!

Of course - it's not far to other creative and culinary experiences:
Learn the in's and ou
host_about:
I have been lucky to have lived in some amazing places - from on a boat in Queensland, to a warehouse apartment in Collingwood, and now in the Barossa Valley where I own a 160 year old railway station.
As a traveller I love to immerse myself in the local culture of the places that I visit... but I know the importance of having a home to return to after a day of exploring (and maybe the odd wine tasting!).   The Station is a truly amazing but liveable space for groups of families and friends.   I am proud to share it with like-minded guests and I know that you will enjoy your stay in the Barossa.

This comfortable house is fully furnished and self contained and is suitable for families and friends to share. Accommodating up to 9 people,. We welcome you to enjoy this lovely, quiet, natural setting, with country fresh air, close to amenities -10 min walk to shops, oval, swimming pool and bush gardens walking trail.
Check out our great walking and bike tracks - 30 min bike ride to Tanunda, Angaston.
Places of interest - Maggie Beers Farm, Manglers Hill and many winery's to mention.

The space
Spacious, open plan house.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the entire house (5 bedrooms, can sleep up to 9 guests - EXCEPT store room, back yard and shed.

Other things to note
On your home stay, we do provide a pull out washing line which is located under the outdoor pergola.
All bedding is supplied along with a bath towel.
We do provide small shampoo, conditioner and body soap for each guest.
