name: Farm stay in Angaston · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 private bath
description:
Modern off-grid home on 10 acres, right in town. Some of the most spectacular valley views and sunsets the Barossa has to offer, all within 1km of the Angaston main street: Restaurants, cafes, supermarket and shops. Large deck, outdoor fire pit and BBQ. Beautifully decorated, large rooms with views of the Barossa Valley, landscaped gardens and horse paddocks. An eco farm stay, right in the middle of Angaston.
There is also an extra queen sized bedroom available if you have travelling companions.

The space
Bedrooms are spacious, tastefully decorated and have valley views.
There is a private lounge and kitchenette area which opens up to your own private deck.
The only space you are sharing with me is the living area with fireplace if you wish.

Guest access
We are within 1km of the centre of Angaston, an easy walk down the hill for a coffee, otherwise, the Barossa is a group of country towns, parking is never a problem! There is
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is a picturesque village in the Barossa Valley. Here you will find restaurants, several cafes, the Barossa Valley Cheese Co, Casa Carboni Italian Cooking School. The new adventure station & nature play precinct is only 500m from the gate, as is the beginning of the Angaston-Nuriootpa Walking Trail.

name: Cottage in Springton · ★4.94 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Be part of Barossa History, and stay in the renovated Hayloft and Stables built by the original Herbig family, who used to live in the nearby famous Herbig Family Tree.

If you want a peaceful, relaxing time, and a base to explore the Barossa, Adelaide Hills and River Murray, the Stables is for you. The original 1890 Stables have been renovated to reflect the bygone era, but have all the modern conveniences available - inc. Chromecast for your streaming services!

Welcome basket provided.

The space
The beauty of The Stables cottage is knowing that The Hayloft is also on the property, should you need extra accommodation for family or friends.

Please note that we charge $25 for each extra adult guest, per day, to cover professional linen service, electricity, water and cleaning. ($20 for children 2-12 years old)

Whether you are visiting the Barossa, the Murray River, the Hills, or you just want a relaxing time away from t
neighborhood_overview:
Checkout where Springton is on a map before booking!

The historic hamlet of Springton, population 600, is located in an amazing location to explore the local area:

The cottages are directly opposite the Edenmae cellar door, for tasting platters and food on Friday, Saturday and Sunday

All the Barossa wineries are within 30 minutes, with the closest being Henschke, Suffield, Eden Hall, Fernfield, Eden Valley, Rileys, Mountadam, etc

A must visit (just 5 mins away) is the Mt Pleasant Farmers Market (every Saturday 8am-12noon) - (Have a wonderful cooked breakfast there) , or you can choose the Barossa Farmers Market in Angaston every Saturday 730 - 1130am.

20 minutes from Historic Angaston, as well as Nuriootpa, Tanunda (go via the Menglers Hill lookout) and Lyndoch.

Take a 1km hike to the beautiful view of the forests and valleys from Mount Pleasant Summit (5 minute drive to trailhead on Glen Devon Rd)

Springton G
host_about: As Airbnb hosts (and Airbnb guests when we travel), we want our gests to have the best experience possible. We are sure you will enjoy either the Stables or the Hayloft as much as we do. We bought this beautiful property for our friends and family to enjoy, and when available, for others such as yourselves. If you need a break from the busy city lifestyle, come and relax in our double hammock, on the boat in the billabong, by one of the two firepits, or a night watching the wood heater in the Stables. The sound of the waterfalls, birds, and flowing water in the ponds adds to the relaxed ambience. Our highlight is to know that we have provided a place of tranquility for all our guests.

name: Guest suite in Nuriootpa · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
‘Crush’ Guest Room is part of the original homestead on the property over 160 years old that Dean and Lou Hewitson have lovingly restored. Stay on a working vineyard and winery in the epicentre of Barossa Valley and enjoy unbridled access to all the Valley has to offer.

Take in the unparalleled views over the vineyard while enjoying a glass of Hewitson at the Tasting Room. As a guest you have the privilege to procure wines from The Hewitson Old & Rare Museum Cellar. Just ask!

The space
‘Crush’ Guest Room is a contemporary space, beautifully furnished for a relaxing and comfortable stay. The King Bed has been fitted with all-natural fibre quality bed linens. The adjoining en-suite bathroom uses local Barossa soaps. The mini-bar includes super-premium Hewitson wines, fridge, kettle with teas, milk & sugar, a Nespresso coffee maker and a light breakfast. The area comes with a flat-screen television, reverse cycle A/C and free wifi. Our guest rooms and wi
neighborhood_overview:
If CRUSH room is not available with your schedule, we have another guest room that you could find on Airbnb (PRESS & FERMENT Room) that might be available for you.
There are great dining options available and all just a few minutes away, which we can highly recommend. Most restaurants accept BYO and please let them know you are our guest. You can purchase wine from your Guest Room and from our Tasting Room; or ask us for our Old & Rare Museum Cellar list and choose something special! let us know in advance. Reds will be left on the mini-bar and whites in the fridge in your room.

Very quiet neighborhood, walking distance to wineries

name: Farm stay in Krondorf · ★4.88 · 5 bedrooms · 7 beds · 3.5 baths
description:
Turret Ridge is the perfect group entertainer. We have 85 acres of farmland to explore with breathtaking views over the whole valley, especially at sunset.

We’re only 10 minutes from Tanunda, (the best village in the Barossa!) and several of the most interesting cellar doors are right on our doorstep.

The space
We can easily accommodate up to 12 ppl in 5 bedrooms.

We have two large lounge rooms which are both appointed with large wood fires for warmth and ambiance.

Kids will be entertained for days either exploring outdoors or in our kids zone where we have loads of arts and crafts, toys, books and games.

Our kitchen is an entertainers dream with huge bench space, gas hob, double oven, dishwasher and loads of fridge space.

Guest access
Guests have exclusive use of the whole house for the duration of their stay - livings areas, kitchen, bedrooms and 85 acres of bush to explore!
neighborhood_overview:
Rural retreat. The only neighbours are kangaroos and the kookaburras who you’ll hear in the mornings.

…but we are only 10 minutes from the wonderful township of Tanunda.

name: Vacation home in Cockatoo Valley · ★4.94 · 8 bedrooms · 9 beds · 4 baths
description:
Balmoral Lodge is a stunning, 1920s farmhouse with all the grandeur of a country estate, exclusively for you to enjoy. Located 5 minutes from Lyndoch and 10 to Gawler, it enjoys the best of town and country. Large, spacious rooms, a huge and bright chef's kitchen with all the facilities to self cater for a large group. Bedrooms are individually decorated and 6 of the bedrooms are ensuite. The spectacular veranda is the place to be, to enjoy sunset views over the lovely valley beyond.

The space
This newly renovated farmhouse retains all the beautiful features from the 1920s and provides every comfort for modern holiday makers. From the huge, open plan kitchen, gracious dining room and elegant lounge room, every effort has been made for your relaxed and luxurious stay.
Enjoy loads of fun in our fabulous new 1980s themed games room, with pool table, Fussball and other amusements.
Bedroooms are large and uncluttered and with 8 suites, there won't be
neighborhood_overview: A lovely rural area with walks to enjoy and lots of wildlife.  Only 10 minutes to the town of Gawler and all the amenities.
host_about: Julie and Peter are passionate home renovators who love travelling, creating beautiful gardens and Julie loves to attempt a little art work and photography when time permits. We share our lives with our wonderful son Scott and adored cat Leonard and love all the wonderful wildlife on our doorstep. We have been very blessed to travel to some amazing places, personal favourites being Venice, U.K, Ha Long Bay, Rhodes, Meteora, Kotor etc.....I could go on with a very long list. We are friendly people who are happy to be as involved or not with your Barossa and Australian travel experience. We have lived all over Australia and can advise on great places not to be missed, both local and elsewhere.

name: Home in Barossa Valley · ★4.96 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
description:
The essence of Barossa living! Fantastic valley view over the vines. Nestled in the bush but only 5 minutes from Tanunda and Nuriootpa. Relax with the whole family at this modern family home with stunning outdoor entertaining area and hot tub overlooking the valley. All the amenities set on 5 acres; the perfect country retreat!

The space
Modern family home; 4 bedrooms - master & ensuite with king bed, 2 queen bedrooms and 1 bedroom with 2 singles. Large open fully equipped kitchen, lounge with uninterrupted views over the valley and workstation for the home office. Double glazed throughout and reverse cycle air con for cosy comfort!

Outdoor entertaining area with fire pit overlooking the valley, undercover hot tub, large outdoor dining table under shade sail and bbq.

**PLEASE NOTE**
Fire pit is strictly not to be used from the 1st Nov - 30th April due to fire ban season. Please be respectful and understanding- thank you.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the heart of the Barossa, you will be staying on the famous Stonewell Road, surrounded by some of Barossa’s most iconic wineries such as Torbreck, Peter Lehman, David Franz, Rolf Binder, Greenock Creek and Seppeltsfield.

You are similarly close to many of the iconic restaurants with Appelation at the Louise walkable from the house but Fino at Seppeltsfield, Maggie Beers and FermentAsian only a short drive. For the spirit lovers amongst you, Seppeltsfield Road Distillery is just around the corner offering gin and cocktails in a stunning setting!

The property is located in the Marananga subregion of the Barossa producing the best of Barossa Shiraz.
host_about:
David and Anna love food, wine and nature travel. Australians but have travelled and lived abroad extensively, currently on an adventure with two young daughters based out of Muscat, Oman.

We hope our properties reflect our love of nature above all else and that appreciation and value will be shared by our guests. 

As hosts ourselves we treat any stay like we would our own house and will treat your home with utmost respect!

name: Home in Tanunda · ★4.94 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
description:
Magpie House is a beautifully appointed home just metres from the main street of Tanunda, location does not get better than this! Take advantage of our free private parking and step out the front gate into the town centre. Surrounded by some of the finest restaurants, bars, cafes and shopping experiences the Barossa Valley has to offer, you will enjoy exploring this charming region right on your door step.

The space
The house is set amongst a quaint cottage garden and is ideal for couples, a family or a group of friends seeking a self contained home away from home. With two Queen bedrooms and two Single rooms we are able to offer stylish and thoughtfully furnished accommodation for everyone. Please be aware that we do lock off bedrooms depending on how many people you book for. The house features two living areas, with a formal lounge situated at the front of the building and an open plan living and dining at the rear. The well equipped kitchen flows into the di
neighborhood_overview: Magpie House is located in the centre of Tanunda. Within walking distance to the main street we're positioned just behind 1918 Bar & Grill and across the road from FermentAsian and the famous Apex Bakery. Next door to the property is the beautiful Tanunda Rotunda Park.
host_about:
Being a fifth generation Barossan I am excited to share this beautiful region with all it has to offer! I pride myself on providing a stylish, modern and clean home for guests to enjoy throughout their stay. I hope you love Magpie House and the township of Tanunda as much as I do. As I live in Tanunda I am just a phone call away should you have any questions or require assistance.
Sandy

name: Cottage in Hamilton · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
The Manor House is a two story building .
There are three bedrooms upstairs (1 King, 1 Queen and 1 Split King), accessible via a set of stairs.
A very comfortable sitting room, fully set up kitchen (Incl. dishwasher, espresso machine) and one bathroom (shower) are downstairs. The Manor House has ducted A/C.
Car parking and free WiFi are available.
Breakfast provisions are supplied.
Dinner can be ordered by prior arrangement
The rate is set per room occupied (max 2 occupants per room).

The space
The Manor House is a historical building which was once the Manager’s and Accountant’s Offices.

name: Bed and breakfast in Hamilton · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Gardeners Cottage
Located in the precinct of Anlaby homestead, this cottage was built for the Head Gardener in the early 1900s. At this time, the Head Gardener was responsible for the 14 gardeners who lovingly tended the historic Anlaby garden.

The cottage has three beautifully appointed Queen bedrooms, two comfortable lounges, a modern bathroom and a fully equipped kitchen. The building sits in its own beautiful cottage garden.

This is an ideal location for a quiet getaway while you take a ¿beautiful step back in time¿ surrounded by modern creature comforts.

The cottage is fitted with a fully ducted air conditioning system and free WIFI is provided.

Locally sourced breakfast provisions are supplied. Evening meals can be pre-booked.

Entire cottage
You will have the entire cottage to yourself

House Rules
Check in 2.00pm-7.00 pm
Check out 10.00 am
No smoking
No pets
No parties or events
neighborhood_overview:
The Head Gardener's Cottage is one of the numerous historical buildings at Anlaby Station.

It has been lovingly restored and now provides modern amenities such as air conditioning, a wood fire, TV and WiFi.

Car parking is available on site.

name: Home in Tanunda · ★4.79 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
description:
Situated on the picturesque Langmeil Estate on the edge of Tanunda, with its quiet streets and beautiful parklands, this large architect designed modern executive home with an impressive garden and 3 en-suite bedrooms is the perfect base for your visit to the wine capital with three excellent wineries within walking distance.

The space
Lochnagar is been thoughtfully set up so our guests lack nothing. From high speed wifi, complimentary bicycles to explore the extensive shared bicycle paths that extend the full length of the Barossa Valley. Our kitchen is fully equipped with all of the appliances you would ever need and all our bed linen and towelling are great quality ensuring total comfort for your stay.

Unfortunately our place is not set up to accomodate children under 12 and infants.

We also don't accept pets.

Guest access
You will have access to the entire place.
neighborhood_overview:
Lochnagar is an ideal location - there are 6 winery cellar doors within 2 kilometres!
• Langmeil Winery
• RieslingFreak
• Peter Lehman Wines
• Auswan Wines
• David Franz
• Rolf Binder Veritas
• Lindsay Wines

The central section of the main street (Murray Street) is 1.8 km from your accommodation. There you will find great restaurants and cafes, including:
• FermentAsian
• 1918
• Tanunda Clubhouse
• Musque
• VinoLocal
• Z Wine

name: Home in Kapunda · ★4.92 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
A quirky stone cottage with WiFi and Netflix in a peaceful street of Kapunda. Kiron is pet friendly with a large secure backyard & doggie door. It's a 5-minute walk to the main street where you'll find a variety of cafes, pubs & eclectic shops. Kiron has 2 bedrooms & a third with a daybed that doubles as a single bed. There is undercover locked parking, a well-equipped kitchen and 3 living areas. There's also a separate loo & the bathroom hosts a rainfall shower over a deep bath.

The space
Kiron has a spacious living area with a large L shaped lounge room. There is a separate "whiskey room" for card games, a bit of alone time or mixing it up with board games.

There's a light filled office area with desk, monitor, wireless keyboard and mouse. A great space for working if you really have to!

Then there is a sunny dining area adjacent to the kitchen - this goes through to a lovely sun-room with plenty of greenery and some comfie arm chairs.<
neighborhood_overview: Robe street is a quiet neighbourhood street. You are just around the corner from the Memorial Gardens and Bowling Club. One block in the other direction is the peaceful duckpond with boardwalk and seating areas. And only a few minutes more walk and you are in the main street. There you will find a large Foodland open 7-7, 7 days/week, many coffee shops, home decorating and flower shops, galleries and even a Woodland Toys shop - where there are no battery operated toys and barely any plastics. And a 24hour service station!

Nestled into the vineyards and only moments away from Lyndoch, Wilsford House has stood tall and proud for more than 100 years in the heart of the Barossa Valley.

A breathtaking view of the Barossa vines and rolling hills greets you upon arrival. When you step inside, you’ll fall in love with how the grace and grandeur of years past has been blended seamlessly with modern elegance.

This unique piece of Barossa History caters exclusively for up to six people.

The space
Wilsford House provides historical charm and modern elegance throughout its 3 large bedrooms and floor heated bathrooms. A luxurious formal dining, spacious kitchen and living and plenty of outdoor entertaining areas are nestled in amongst manicured gardens and superb vineyard views. A full sized laundry with washer/drier makes it perfect for those wanting a longer stay to immerse themselves in the best the Barossa has to offer.

name: Bungalow in Angaston · ★5.0 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3 baths
description:
Welcome to "Benbullen Retreat". A stunning 5 bedroom, 3 bathroom, blue-stone homestead set on 10 acres of immaculate parkland grounds in the Barossa Valley. For your own private enjoyment, Benbullen is the ideal destination for up to 10 persons. You will be spoilt with your own stunning views over the Barossa. This is Barossa Accommodation at it's best - The ultimate retreat, oozing charm and quality throughout.

The space
From the moment you drive up the tree lined driveway to the homestead, you will experience the true nature of Barossa living. The expansive house boasts a gourmet Hamptons style kitchen plus several living areas including a sun-filled conservatory. Whether you choose to dine at the long oak table or relax in the sitting room on the character chesterfields, the choice is yours. There is one guarantee - picture perfect views from every window.
neighborhood_overview: Centrally located between Tanunda and Angaston you will experience the true serenity of The Barossa Valley.
host_about: Janine currently runs her own beautiful 5 star reviewed bed and breakfast in the quaint village of Greenock along with managing the stunning Benbullen Retreat in the heart of The Barossa. Janine has passionately developed her work within tourism to a full-time capacity, gaining a reputable name as a high quality accommodation provider in the Barossa Valley. Janine will be your host during your stay at Benbullen Retreat and The Clyde, ensuring you have the most ultimate accommodation experience the Barossa has to offer.

description:
Accommodation with an environmental focus. Stay off grid, in a tiny historic hamlet. Situated between the Barossa Valley and the Adelaide Hills. name: Cottage in Seppeltsfield · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description: Welcome to our charming cottage in Seppeltsfield. This historic gem offers a peaceful  retreat for your stay. With its heritage exterior and modern amenities, the cottage accommodates up to 4 guests. Immerse yourself in Seppeltsfield’s rich heritage, within walking distance of nearby Wineries and Restaurants, or simply soak up the views across the vineyards. Experience the perfect blend of old-world charm and contemporary comfort in our Seppeltsfield cottage.
neighborhood_overview: Seppeltsfield  is a charming and historic destination nestled in the picturesque Barossa Valley in South Australia. With its quaint heritage buildings, rolling vineyards, and a sense of timeless beauty, Seppeltsfield offers a captivating experience for visitors. Within a short walk is the renowned Seppeltsfield Winery, which boasts a rich heritage spanning over 170 years. Visitors can explore the historic cellars, indulge in exquisite wine tastings, dine at Fino Restaurant, enjoy a coffee at Octeine or immerse themselves with the local artisans including The Jam Factory, Vasse Virgin, Gardner Knives and more. After a long day enjoy the west facing verandah watching the sun setting over the palm trees and vines. Sit back and enjoy the quiet, serene surroundings while looking up at the stars and the Milky Way. Seppeltsfield is a delightful destination that captures the essence of the Barossa Valley's wine country charm.

Accommodation with an environmental focus. Stay off grid, in a tiny historic hamlet. Situated between the Barossa Valley and the Adelaide Hills. All bookings receive a bottle of local Springton/Eden Valley wine and a cheese plater box from the Barossa Cheese Company.

description:
Unwind at this unique, rustic and tranquil getaway. Relax and explore the properties 20 acres of Mt Crawford Forest and farm land. In the evenings you can sit back with your feet up and take in the view or enjoy a glass of wine curled up in front of the fire. You have the house to yourself to settle in to, equipped with 2 bedrooms, a full kitchen and lounge room. Plenty of parking for cars and room to roam. Situated in the Barossa Valley and on the door step to the amazing Adelaide Hills.

The space
The property is surrounded by the Mt Crawford Forest, it has many beautiful trails through the forest for walking, hiking or cycling. The surrounds are quite and peaceful so you can really get away from the hustle and bustle of city life. Go adventuring through the day to local wineries and attractions or just sit and listen to all the amazing bird sounds and wildlife.

Emma & Roger

description:
Relax as a couple, or the whole family, at our peaceful cottage. Historic Lyndoch is the ideal place from which to experience the famous Barossa Valley. The cottage is just a short 800 metres from shops, bakery, and more. Restaurants and vineyards are within minutes. We supply 3 free bicycles to explore the Barossa Cycling trails (Pre booking required). Another 2 bedroom cottage is available on the same site. Search airbnb for " 2 bedrooms with Woodfire, Barossa Country Cottages " .

The space
Each cottage has 2 full bedrooms, a full kitchen, 3 way bathroom, and separate lounge/dining area. Free Wi-fi is available, a 50inch TV, and chromecast for streaming. There is a balcony with outdoor chairs at the front of each cottage, and a communal barbeque area as well. There is even a washing machine in each cottage. There is also a children's playgym.
This cottage has one bedroom with a queen bed, and the second bedroom has two single beds. There is also a double

name: Home in Tanunda · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
description:
Its all about the location.... Immerse yourself into the heart of the iconic Barossa Valley and stay at the Idyllic, Character filled bungalow - Sierra Madre.
A Beautiful, quaint and very charming property conveniently situated only meters from the ever so popular Tanunda main street. Take your pick of coffee shops, cafes, restaurants, cellar doors, shopping, and more.
Or... Choose to stay in, unwind, relax and surround yourself in a beautiful and well appointed little piece of paradise.

The space
Sierra Madre is full of character, beautifully presented and feels like home.
It offers you 3 spacious bedrooms sleeping up to 6 people, Main Bedroom with a smart T.V. Open plan living, dining and kitchen with dishwasher, stove, oven, microwave, full size fridge, coffee machine, and Bose speaker. The open plan area also includes a wood burning fire for those cooler nights. There is also a second living area, delightful newly renovated bathroom, full lau
neighborhood_overview:
You wont find a much better location than this!
Sierra Madre is a short 2 minute walk to the hub of Tanunda.
You are walking distance to everything you need, Information Center, Supermarket, Bakery, Restaurant's, Bars, Cafes, Bottle shop, Retail Shopping, Playground / Oval and more.

The Barossa is made up of some beautiful little towns only a short drive away, and they all offer something different. So we encourage you to take a drive around and find some of our unique spots, You wont be disappointed.
There is always plenty to do and something for everyone.

Explore the many cellar doors and wineries, enjoy a relaxing long lunch at one of the many restaurants, take a stroll through the conservation park, visit the bustling farmers market, stroll the streets, or perhaps book yourself in for an unforgettable experience somewhere. So much to see and do.

neighborhood_overview:
Escape to Greenock, South Australia: 'The best-kept secret in the Barossa Valley'. Less than an hour from Adelaide’s CBD, the charming village of Greenock is the gateway to the Barossa Valley wine region.

Take a stroll down to El Estanco cafe for breakfast and coffee, lunch, or dinner at their ‘Friday Fiestas’. Enjoy a good pub meal at the 'Greenock', or a platter at one of the cellar doors which are within walking distance of your cottage stay. One of many local hangouts, Greenock Brewers’ have a selection of small-batch beers. If you need a pre-dinner snack, grab yourself a produce platter and while away the afternoon.

Explore the lovely towns of Sepplestfield and Maranaga just a few minutes' drive away or a little further on - the towns of Tanunda, Nuriootpa and also Angaston - here you will find the Barossa Farmers Market with its abundant selection of fresh fruit and vegetables, herbs, meats, speciality bread, Barossa’s famous smallgoods, fresh milk, stunni

name: Rental unit in Tanunda · ★4.14 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Relax with the whole family at this peaceful place to stay.

The space

host_about:
The Wine Vine Hotel offers affordable accommodations in the heart of the Barossa wine region, less than 1.2 km from the Barossa Wine and Visitor Center.

All rooms at the The Wine Vine Hotel include air conditioning, electric blankets, and a private outdoor veranda.

You can enjoy a game of tennis on the court, and in the summer season between October and April you can enjoy a swim in the pool.

The The Wine Vine Hotel gives you easy access to over 100 wineries. Famous local attractions are Mengler Hill Scenic Look-out, Conservation Park Bush, and the Whispering Wall.

The Barossa Cheese Company, Lyndoch Lavender Farm, Concordia Fruit Wines, and Maggie Beer's Farm Shop are all a short drive from the motel.

Couples in particular like the location – they rated it 8.5 for a two-person trip.

The Wine Vine Hotel has been welcoming (Website hidden by Airbnb) guests since Apr 19, 2010

name: Cottage in Angaston · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
description:
The Rusty Olive is an intimate lovers retreat nestled in the heart of Angaston, one of the most beautiful towns in the Barossa Valley wine region. The cottage is located in a quiet street, a 5-min walk to cafes, wine bar, popular restaurants, gourmet cheese shop, local bakery, butcher & much more. Only a 15-min drive to the wine region, it's ideal for a romantic getaway.

Come and relax under the rustic pergola area and prepare yourself a tasty gourmet breakfast with local produce supplied.

The space
The early settlers cottage has been lovingly restored to retain the charm of a bygone era but with modern-day comforts. It offers a functional kitchen with a dishwasher and coffee machine. Provisions are supplied for breakfast, made from the best local produce, on the first morning of your stay.

Absorb the ambient beauty of the bathroom where you can relax in a cast iron, claw foot bath or a spacious shower, alone or together.

In the b
neighborhood_overview:
Angaston, South Australia, Australia . Angaston is the prettiest town in the Barossa with a rich history and beautiful gardens. it has a wonderful German butcher, bakery and gourmet cheese shop plus restaurants and cafes all within walking distance of The Rusty Olive.

At sunset, unwind with a glass of Barossa wine on the front verandah overlooking the old stone faced St Hugh's Anglician Church, opened in 1931.
host_about:
A short history of ownership... The Rusty Olive was built in 1900 and was bought in an unrestored state by Sue and Michael Falkenberg in 2008. Sue and Michael then spent some 8 years restoring it to the magnificent building you see today. The original stonework was preserved, and the interior completely rebuilt with a sympathetic mix of modern and existing features. 

The home was designed as a luxury retreat and has been operating as an Airbnb since 2018. In April 2022, Sue and Michael sold the property to the current owners, Adam and Marilyn Laws. They fell in love with the Rusty Olive after staying for two weeks early in 2022. Marilyn grew up in the Barossa Valley and most of her family still reside here. Now based in Sydney, they regularly return “home” to experience the great lifestyle and family experiences in the Barossa. 

We hope you enjoy your stay in The Rusty Olive.

name: Villa in Lyndoch · ★4.92 · 5 bedrooms · 5.5 baths
description:
The Yaldara House is a luxurious 5 bedroom accommodation venue situated at Chateau Yaldara on the banks of the Lyndoch Creek. Originally built by the founder of Chateau Yaldara, Hermann Thumm, it has been lovingly restored to now provide you with an ideal location to base your Barossa Valley Holiday or simply hide away in the Yaldara house and enjoy wine and an escape from everyday life.

The space
5 Deluxe bedrooms with ensuite bathroom, all Queen size beds. An ideal location to base you and up to 10 friends in the Barossa Valley.
neighborhood_overview: Chateau Yaldara. Hermann Thumm founded Chateau Yaldara in 1947 after he migrated to Australia from Europe. The chateau was named ‘Yaldara’ after the local Aboriginal word meaning ‘sparkling’. The site chosen for the winery was on the banks of the North Para River at a flax mill dating back to 1867.
host_about: Awesome Holidays provides some of the most wonderful accommodation and unique winery experiences in the Barossa Valley. With dedicated staff based in the Barossa Valley, we know the Barossa Valley and can offer experiences that we have planned to perfection and enjoyed ourselves. We will ensure that your visit in the Barossa Valley will be as memorable as the Barossa is Magnificent.

name: Cottage in Angaston · ★4.88 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
The space
Barossa on Sturt is a luxury retreat nestled in the heart of the Barossa Valley. A beautiful stone cottage with authentic heritage detailing. Guests enjoy the luxury of the French style lounge room including wood fireplace, fully equipped kitchen with oven and dining area.

The front verandah and paved courtyard at rear offer tranquil outdoor dining spaces. Continental breakfast is included; fresh milk and yogurt, cereals, fresh juice and sourdough.

Nestled in the heart of the Barossa wine region, it’s only a 10 minute drive to discover Penfolds, Yalumba, Two Hands, Langmeil & Henschke wineries, Maggie Beer’s Farm Shop & Restaurant, and more.

Angaston Township is a 4 minute walk away, including The Barossa Valley Cheese Co, wine bars, and plentiful restaurants and cafes. The Barossa Farmer’s Market, held every Saturday, is only 3 minutes down the road. Located a 3 minute walk away, multiple buses provide easy access to some of the b
neighborhood_overview:
The Barossa is an internationally-acclaimed wine region encompassing the towns of Tanunda, Angaston and Nuriootpa, boasting more than 150 wineries and 80 cellar doors.

Just a 50 minute drive north east of Adelaide, When you’re not sipping the region’s top drops you can admire the vines from a hot air balloon, dine at renowned restaurants and explore nearby villages and national parks.

name: Cottage in Angaston · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Stoneleigh Cottage is a heritage listed property located in the main street of Angaston, in the heart of the Barossa Valley. The cottage is divided into two self- contained one bedroom units, that accommodate one couple in each unit. The units have their own entrances and carport as well as a fully equipped kitchen, lounge, bathroom and laundry room. Perfect for a mid-week retreat or a wine weekend with friends.

name: casa particular in Gawler West · ★4.33 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
description:
Enjoy easy access to the popular Barrosa Valley wineries, shops and restaurants from this charming place to stay in Gawler.

We are located next to a beautiful park full of native trees and home of all native birds that enjoy of the water of the Para River, short walk to town centre (15 min walk through park), train stations (3), 15 min drive to the heart of the famous Barrosa Valley and 40 min away from Adelaide CBD and airport!

You’ll stay in a private room in first floor.

The space
This is a two story unit and you will be staying at the first floor all on your own.
Room is private with own ensuite and walk-in wardrobe, kitchenette, 3 seaters couch, access to patio and through the gate to the local park.
I love clean and tidy spaces and your space is not the exception!

We will provide you with english breakfast and plenty of space in the downstairs 2 doors huge fridge to keep all your food fresh.

Upstairs i
neighborhood_overview:
This is a small complex of 4 units, quiet, clean and green area where you can find peace and a lot of rest without interruption or noise.
We have 1 train station close to home (Gawler station) and another two further north, the first one is within walking distance as well as 500mts away from Bus stop.
You can always park on the street (outside the complex) there is plenty of space!
host_about:
I'm passionate about travelling, meet new people and enjoy a good talk about travel, experiences and culture! 
I usually travel with my husband who shares the same values and friendless with people .. we simply love travelling and knowing new places :)

name: Home in Kapunda · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Experience the unhurried backcountry retreat at Horse Side Tiny House! The ideal farm stay South Australia escape nestled in wide-open spaces, native birdlife, and farm animals (e.g., such as horses, sheep, and alpacas) to keep you company. An amazing piece of paradise, where you can take deep calming breaths and lazy afternoon naps in Kapunda. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: Please note that the tiny house is only a short distance from the main street, so you may hear passing vehicles on the property.

The space
Horse Side Tiny House is located near Barossa Valley, Kapunda Tourist Park, and Whispering Wall are just a few of the attractions in the area. A comfortable accommodation with easy access to water, split air conditioning, a kitchenette, cooking equipment, and excellent bathroom facilities.

The bathroom follows ecologically sustainable principles, including a cassette toilet with a removable waste-holding tank, hand basin, and shower (gas heated for
neighborhood_overview:
Horse Side Tiny House sits in a small town near Barossa Valley in South Australia. Where you can explore restaurants, shops, and attractions for you to enjoy. So, make an endless list of things to do.

Our local recommendations:

- Pizza Bar and Takeaway serves a diverse selection of ingredients for dine-in and takeaway pizzas in town.
- One White Kite is a cafe that offers a delicious selection of pastries, light meals, coffee, and tea in Kapunda.
- Kapunda Mine Trail is a popular attraction that marks the first commercially copper metal mine in Australia.
- Kapunda Tourist Park is a camping and cabin accommodation set in a well-shaded park in Dutton Park, Kapunda.
- Whispering Wall is a popular attraction where "whispered words" can be heard 140 meters away from the other end of the dam.

If you want to know more, you can check out "Things to Do near Kapunda."
host_about: Tiny Away spearheads the tiny house eco-tourism in Australia. It started because of our desire to offer city dwellers the perfect place to escape from their hectic digital life in the city. Riding on the international trend in tiny houses, we have taken the tiny house movement one step further by partnering with land hosts and placing our beautifully designed and handcrafted tiny homes on wheels in spectacular rural settings. By integrating the concept of tiny houses with eco-tourism, we want to allow everyone a chance to experience the tiny house lifestyle - To Discover Nature and Stay in Comfort.

name: Cottage in Tanunda · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
The perfect place for a couples Barossa getaway.

Tanunda main is a gorgeous 1915 built sandstone fronted cottage barely a 5 minute walk to the towns vibrant tourist centre. It's a perfect location to relax, unwind, and meander down to great restaurants, pubs, cafe's and wine bars.

The space
It's a spacious updated symmetrical cottage with an easy floor plan, high ceilings, Baltic pine floorboards, leadlight windows and decorative fireplaces.

Lounge room with a reverse cycle air conditioner, DVD player and a 65inch TV.
Air conditioned country style kitchen with a gas cooktop and electric oven, fridge, microwave & cooking utensils.
A light filled dining space, rear deck with a bbq and an outdoor setting in the private fenced yard.
1 bathroom and toilet, and a washing machine for guests use.

King bed, ceiling fans, TV's and local antique furnishings.

Soak up the cottage ambience from the front vera
neighborhood_overview: Situated in the Historical conservation area surrounded by other character homes. Close to all the town amenities, shops cafes and restaurants.

name: Guest suite in Nuriootpa · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
'Ferment' Guest Suite is part of the original homestead on the property over 160 years old that Dean and Lou Hewitson have lovingly restored. Stay on a working vineyard and winery in the epicentre of Barossa Valley and enjoy unbridled access to all the Valley has to offer.

Take in the unparalleled views over the vineyard while enjoying a glass of Hewitson at the Tasting Room. As a guest you have the privilege to procure wines from The Hewitson Old & Rare Museum Cellar. Just ask!

The space
‘Ferment’ Suite is a contemporary space, beautifully furnished for a relaxing and comfortable stay. The Suite opens to a living room with a window bench seat with remote control curtains and a flat screen television. This adjoins a dining area with electric fireplace leading to a kitchenette including the mini-bar fridge and wine fridge stocked with super-premium Hewitson wines, dishwasher, sink with hot and cold water, toaster, toastie sandwich maker, microwave, kett
neighborhood_overview:
If FERMENT Suite is not available with your schedule, we have another guest room that you could find on Airbnb (CRUSH & PRESS Room) that might be available for you.
There are great dining options available and all just a few minutes away, which we can highly recommend. Most restaurants accept BYO and please let them know you are our guest. You can purchase wine from your Guest Room and from our Tasting Room; or ask us for our Old & Rare Museum Cellar list and choose something special! let us know in advance. Reds will be left on the mini-bar and whites in the fridge in your room.

name: Guest suite in Bethany · ★4.29 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Take in an enormous panoramic view, Blickinstal Barossa Valley Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills, which is just 5-min drive from Tanunda. Our properties are surrounded by vineyard and beautiful natural landscape where you can enjoy the stunning sunsets and brilliant star-filled night sky.

Located in the central of Barossa Valley, it is closed to an expansive range of wineries and restaurants. This studio is perfect for couples as a lovely base to explore the Barossa Valley.

The space
This is a self-contained studio Blickinstal Barossa Valley Retreat, which can host 2 guests., The studio features a queen bed with starred-hotel linens, a kitchenette, and a bathroom.

In the common area, there are BBQ facilities and outdoor dining seating with a fantastic panoramic view. Outdoor fire pit is available outside of the fire danger season (1st May – 30th Nov). You can also find a shared laundry room on premises.

Other things
neighborhood_overview: Blickinstal Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills where an expansive range of wineries and restaurants is located. It is only a 5-minute drive to Tunanda and some renowned cellar doors.
host_about:
Roger and I love traveling, we fell in love with Australia on our honeymoon and moved to here 10 years ago. I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

name: Home in Tanunda · ★4.94 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Live like a local and enjoy this stylish and spacious property, surrounded by vineyards just 2 minutes from Tanunda's main street. Inside you will find a fully equipped kitchen, lounge and dining room with woodburning stove and sunset views. Outside you will find a landscaped garden with a BBQ and veranda, fire pit, and more spectacular vineyard view. Beyond the house take a 15-minute stroll into Tanunda and enjoy the Barossa's central hub with several restaurants, bars, pubs and a brewery.

The space
Our home is just right for families, couples or friends and has everything you need for a great stay. Little touches such as local coffee from Barossa Coffee Roasters and eco friendly cleaning & shower products from Zero Co mean all you need to bring is your bags.

Furry friends are welcome too, with a full enclosed garden!

Guest access
The whole house and garden are yours to enjoy. There is also a shed and garage which are off limit
neighborhood_overview: We are located just outside Tanunda, with its wineries, cafes, boutiques and restaurants. From the house it's a 5 minute walk to Turkey Flat winery or Barossa Valley Brewing, or take a 15 minute stroll into Tanunda for a coffee or bite to eat. Alternatively take a 10 minute drive to world famous wineries including Jacobs Creek, Seppeltsfield and Penfolds. Or simply stay at home and enjoy sunset over the vines, and maybe even moonrise over the hills on the right night.
host_about: I'm a restauranteur, chef and winemaker in the Barossa Valley. I moved to the Barossa from the UK to pursue my passion for wine. The Winemaker's Haus was our first home and the place where it all started for me and my wife. I am co-owner of Harvest Kitchen and produce wines under my own label - Haus Wine. With over 20 years of hospitality experience and an enthusiasm for all things food and drink I decided it was time to host my own guest house and help people discover the Barossa and all its wonder!

name: Villa in Tanunda · ★5.0 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 5 baths
description:
Prepare to be wowed as you enter this stunning home and discover your private luxury escape set on an acre of beautiful grounds in the heart of Tanunda. A 5 minute walk to excellent restaurants, cafes and wine bars, Tanunda House, with its 5 King bedrooms, pool, tennis court, wine cellar and theatre room is a perfect setting for a relaxing retreat or to celebrate a special occasion with friends, family or colleagues. It is also an ideal base for exploring the world renowned Barossa wine region.

The space
Immaculately presented, Tanunda House boasts the grandeur of its 1910 heritage in its front rooms with high pressed metal ceilings and the original stained glass entrance, then seamlessly moves into a stunning contemporary space featuring indoor and outdoor living/dining with floor to ceiling glass looking over the beautiful swimming pool and gardens. Everything you need, Tanunda House has on offer:

- Five spacious King Bedrooms three of which can be
neighborhood_overview:
Tanunda House is located in the attractive town of Tanunda which is the heart of the world renowned Barossa wine region. A walk around the neighbourhood will lead you down leafy streets past beautiful sandstone homes, historic cottages and a number of lovely old churches - a testament to the Lutheran settlement of the region. Only 50 metres from Tanunda House is Goat Square - an historic meeting place which is now a lovely green lawn surrounded on all sides by heritage 1840s stone cottages.
Restaurants, cafes and wine bars and a wonderfully eclectic selection of shops and galleries for browsing are a short 5 minute walk away from Tanunda House but if you get in your car you can be out driving past vineyards, wineries and charming villages within minutes.

name: Guesthouse in Springton · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description: This homey studio is extra comfortable, fully equipped and pet-friendly. There's an expansive garden and fenced area for a dog to run, and beautiful pastoral surroundings.  Also a connected patio with BBQ and wood oven.  Sleeps 3 adults
neighborhood_overview: The Eden Valley is the higher altitude section of the Barossa Region, which produces world class cool climate wines, but it is also a peaceful and less populated area, so it is perfect for just relaxing and unwinding. There are vineyards and a few cellar doors nearby but there are many more 20 minutes away down in the valley itself. Springton is 2 kms away and has a general store and a pub. Nearest supermarkets are 20 mins away.

name: Farm stay in Mount Pleasant · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Pet friendly rural farm stay. Newly renovated & fitted out apartment. Views overlooking tall gums & dam , listen to the kookaburras singing, say hi to our beautiful friendly horses. Walking distance to township filled with some unique shops. Farmers market held each Saturday morning just a mere walk down the driveway.
An easy drive to the beautiful Barossa Valley wine region to taste all the Barossa has to offer.
Close to Mt Crawford forest for those who like to be do some bush walking

The space
Your space is at ground level overlooking our property Modern open plan area, quiet location. Kitchen appointed with microwave, induction hot plate, fridge / freezer , coffee maker. Spacious bathroom / ensuite.
QS bed quality linen.
Flat screen wall mounted smart tv, internet , wifi available. You will have the entire ground floor area to yourself, private courtyard with Baby Q webber for bbq cooking, table and chairs which looks out across our hor
neighborhood_overview:
Walking distance to township where you can find some quirky shops, a fabulous gin distillery called Robbers Dog a must visit.
Rustic Edge home and western wear filled with amazing gifts and clothing and flowers.
As we are the gateway to Barossa Valley wine region it’s a short drive to experience all the valley has to offer.
Into a bit of bush walking ? Mt Crawford forest just down the road some lovely bush trails to explore.
Travel east and you will find the River Murray and Mannum Falls. Another short drive takes you into the heart of Adelaide Hills so much to see there the iconic town Hahndorf.
As you can see we are very central to so much.

name: Guesthouse in Marananga · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Marananga Cottages are located in the heart of Marananga, an ideal venue from which to experience the delights of the Barossa Valley.


This enchanting cottage comprises three individual suites, all self-contained and ideal for couples. All suites have access to free Wi-Fi.
The cottage is perfectly located to access the many wineries and restaurants in the historic Seppeltsfield area, all just a short distance from your accommodation.

The space
Kates Suite is an intimate and comfortable space in the heart of wine country.
Continental breakfast is provided along with tea, coffee, microwave and other B&B amenities.
Queen size bed - maximum 2 people.
host_about: Hi, my name is Wendy and I am your host. I look forward to hosting you at our beautiful Marananga Cottages. I am available 7 Days from 9am to 8pm for any enquiries. For after hours I am contactable on the phone number given to you with your itinerary

name: Guest suite in Angaston · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
description:
This modern, studio style suite has everything you need for a wonderful stay in the Barossa Valley. With only a short 10 minute stroll into the heart of Angaston, you can visit a range of coffee shops and eateries, or take a drive to some world-renowned wineries. After a day out exploring, wind down with a wine and a luxe charcuterie board at sunset in your own private courtyard space overlooking the Angaston hills.

The space
The guest suite is part of a newly built rural property and all the features are bright, modern and clean. Mod cons include a reverse cycle air conditioner/heater. Enjoy some down time in front the 50' smart TV. You will have access to a small range of cooking facilities including a BBQ in your own outdoor area.

Guest access
Guests have their own private parking which leads to the entrance-way to the suite. Enjoy views of the rolling hills of Angaston in your private courtyard area, including the famous Yalumba Winer
neighborhood_overview: The peaceful, leafy township of Angaston holds all the charm and character you will come to expect. While we share fences with our neighbours, visible physical buildings from your room is minimal.

name: Villa in Nuriootpa · ★5.0 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3 baths
description: The Reserve Barossa is Brilliant and Unique for so many reasons. Set amongst some of Australia’s best vineyards on the best street in the Barossa, Seppeltsfield Road. 6 acres and > 10 people in 5 bedrooms. It has an open plan full kitchen, 3 bathrooms, living and dining areas, laundry, small library/wine room and open fire. There are magnificent vineyard views, large outdoor area with a pizza oven. The Reserve Barossa is the perfect escape to relax & indulge all the Barossa has to offer.

name: Guesthouse in Williamstown · ★4.96 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
‘The Wattle’ is your cozy home away from home. The property boasts 10 acres in a private location nestled on the border of a pine forest. You can sit back and relax with a wine from one of the many local wineries, taking in the views of the hilly landscape.

The space
A unique barn style home that is completely self contained. Featuring an open plan studio style layout, large kitchen and dining area, huge bathroom with beautiful walk through shower, comfy king size bed and alfresco dining area on the deck.
Features
-A/C
-Fridge
-Plenty of parking
-fully equipped kitchen
Extra info
Every guest will receive a fresh loaf of bread, tea and coffee amenities and farm fresh eggs to enjoy during their stay. Owners live on the property however the space is totally private and separate from main house.

Guest access
The Wattle studio is located to the left of the main driveway. Please park in the bay out front.
<
neighborhood_overview: Williamstown is a great little town. I recommend booking in for a meal at The Old Bakehouse Tavern on the Main Street and checking out our little local op shop for a bargain. We have great walking trails & picnic spots at the South Para Reservoir. Of course there are lots of great wineries close by.

description:
Classic stone cottage set amongst beautiful gardens on a large block right in the heart of Tanunda. Walk to the main street with cafes, bars, pubs, restaurants and wineries all at your doorstep. Easy access to over 80 wineries and cellar doors. Outdoor entertaining areas. Secure yard for pets. Great getaway for family and friends in the beautiful Barossa Valley.

The space
Three generous bedrooms. New kitchen with European appliances. Smart TV and WiFi. Reverse Cycle Air Conditioning and fans, wood fired heater in lounge room. BBQ and outdoor entertaining areas. Large yard with herbs and vegetable picking garden. Washing machine and dryer. Table tennis table. Very Pet friendly with rear garden fully fenced.

Guest access
Full house, gardens and secure fenced backyard.

Other things to note
Tea, French plunger coffee, milk, sugar and biscuits are provided. Help yourself to herbs and veggies and fruit from the pi

Easy walk to the main street with bars, cellar doors, cafes, pubs, restaurants, clothes and homeware shops and Barossa Visitors Centre. name: Rental unit in Angaston · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
description:
Enjoy easy access to everything from this perfectly located home base.

The space
At Angaston Mews Apartments you can enjoy modern apartment style living with all amenities, including free WiFi. Recently updated, each of our four apartments are perfect for couples, families, group get-togethers or corporate travellers.

Apartments offer a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher. Other features include lounge/dining, Tv, air-conditioning, two bedrooms, one bathroom with spa bath & shower. Standard bedroom configuration is one king bed and two singles. Kings may be split into singles or singles joined to be one king. A double sofa bed is also available for 2 guests.

Each apartment has a patio area and laundry facilities are provided. Outdoors there is undercover parking, a barbecue/outdoor entertaining area.

name: Villa in Bethany · ★4.55 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
Take in an enormous panoramic view, Blickinstal Barossa Valley Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills, which is just 5-min drive from Tanunda. Our properties are surrounded by vineyard and beautiful natural landscape where you can enjoy the stunning sunsets and brilliant star-filled night sky.

Located in the central of Barossa Valley, it is close to an expansive range of wineries and restaurants. This studio is perfect for couples as a lovely base to explore the Barossa Valley.

The space
This is a self-contained villa in Blickinstal Retreat, which can host 6 guests, The villa features three separate bedrooms with starred-hotel linens, a living room, a well-functioned kitchen, and a laundry. The villa provides a relaxed and intimate space with stunning views over the vineyard.

• Master Suite – Double Bed with Airconditioning
• Bedroom 2 – Queen Bed
• Bedroom 3 – Queen Bed
Living room - with Airconditioning
neighborhood_overview: Blickinstal Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills where an expansive range of wineries and restaurants is located. It is onlya  5-minute drive to Tunanda and some renowned cellar doors.
host_about:
Roger and I love traveling, we fell in love with Australia on our honeymoon and moved to here 10 years ago. I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

name: Cottage in Tanunda · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
description:
‘Para River Cottage’

Built in 1920 overlooking the gum studded cliff face of the North Para River, this quaint and cosy cottage has been elegantly restored for your fulfilment.

Embrace the quiet rural feel of native birdsong and scattered sheep across the way, all whilst being within a short stroll of the heart of Tanunda.

It’s a great spot to discover the Barossa Valley and a lovely neighbourhood. I have so many great memories here, and I’m convinced that you will too.

description: Situatued at the center of our Kesehills Winery. The villa is surrounded by the beauty of nature. description:
Spacious Barossa Getaway provides a relaxed space for those who looks for an escape to a vineyard. Here you'll enjoy the beautiful scenery of Barossa.

Located in the central of Barossa Valley, it's close to an expansive range of wineries and restaurants. This beautiful and comfortable house is perfect for friends and families as a lovely base to explore Barossa Valley.

Pool is only available from November to March.

The space
**Please note that the matress is only available for bookings of 7-8 people. If you would like to use the matress, please book for at least 7 people.**

This is a self-contained house with 3 bedrooms and 2.5 bathrooms

• Bedroom 1 – a King Bed
• Bedroom 2 – a Queen Bed ( and a Queen-size mattress with 7-8pp booking)
• Bedroom 3 – a Queen Bed

• Bathroom 1 - Shower and Toilet
• Bathroom 2 - Bath, Shower with no toilet
• Bathroom 3 - Shower and Toilet ( outside the house)<
neighborhood_overview: Spacious Barossa Getaway is lcoated in a quiet neighbourhood where an expansive range of wineries and restaurants are around. It is only few minute drive to Barossa Central and some renowned cellar doors.
host_about:
Roger and I love traveling, we fell in love with Australia on our honeymoon and moved to here 10 years ago. I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

There is ample parking, more than enough for horse floats.

name: Tiny home in Cromer Barossa · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN
Petit Manor is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley on 50 picturesque acres of land with rolling farmland, trees and hills. Perfect for a romantic getaway, the tiny house is set in a scenic location surrounded by alpacas and provides a pleasing blend of modern conveniences in a tranquil setting. It has one bedroom with a queen size bed, a small kitchen and lounge area, it also has a deck and verandah that you can enjoy any time of day. approx 1 hour from city.

The space
We are a working alpaca farm and will often be doing work in the paddocks, we will also be using the tractor, sometimes near the tiny house. This space is not remote, it is close to our house and the other bnb but it is tucked up behind the sheds.

Guest access
Guests can walk around our property but we ask that they do not enter any gates that are closed as we move animals around all the time. They can look around at the gardens, th
neighborhood_overview: We are approx 5 mins from Birdwood where you will find a supermarket, pub, bakery, takeaway and other small shops.  We are located approx 1 hour from the city and half an hour to Tanunda, approx 20 mins to Woodside. Sites to see are Gumeracha Rocking Horse, Lavender Farm, Whispering Wall, Hiking trails, nature walks, Warren reservoir where you can hire kayaks, Birdwood Motor Museum and lots of wineries.
host_about: I am a mortgage broker and my husband is a carpenter.  We enjoy renovating houses and are renting this one out for the first time as a bnb.  We own an alpaca farm in Cromer, where you can pat and walk the animals, we currently have approx 15 alpacas on the farm.  We have 3 grown children and 2 dogs.  We also enjoy travelling.

description:
The Fergusson House is situated in Lyndoch the doorstep of the renowned Barossa Valley wine district. Great for groups to enjoy, or family holidays, and a bonus of being pet friendly. A large comfortable house that sleeps 8, making for a memorable Barossa experience that can be used as a base while exploring The Barossa Valley / or a relaxing getaway with a 6-seater therapeutic spa to enjoy. Ample parking including enough space for a caravan or boat. Available for short and long-term stays.

The space
The Fergusson House has 4 bedrooms - (a living area with a sofa bed, which can be used as an extra bedroom) 2 living rooms, and 2 large outdoor entertaining areas which includes a 6 -seater therapeutic spa.

Hi, we offer a spacious property with 5 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and 3 separate living areas!. We can sleep up to 11 guests. All our rooms have brand new, luxurious, pillow top mattresses. Main bedroom has a king bed, 3 bedrooms have queen beds, and the fifth bedroom has a bunk with double on the base, single on the top. All linen is professionally laundered by Alsco linen service. We are in the heart of the Barossa Valley. We manage the property ourselves and are particularly clean conscious!.

The space
We have 2 main living areas. A formal lounge for peaceful relaxation, large family room with air conditioning and a cosy slow combustion fireplace for winter!. There is also another entertaining room off the main living with a pool table!!. This provides a little fun for the guests!. The main dining table seats 8 comfortably. name: Guesthouse in Angaston · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
A unique experience to be off grid, in complete comfort whilst only 800m from Angaston’s town centre in the Barossa Valley, our self-contained apartment offers unsurpassed views of the Valley floor.
Enjoy a bottle of our boutique wine whilst watching the amazing sunset over the Valley floor, or explore our block for a picnic.
The apartment, under the roof of our home, has its own private entry, studio room, kitchenette and ensuite, all run by hosts keen to make your stay
as amazing as possible!

The space
We are on a block with 15acres with views over the valley floor and back over Angaston.
We are off grid, meaning we are powered by solar with a generator back up. This may kick in on days that are quite overcast.

Guest access
Guests will enter their private studio via our service yard.

description:
Perfectly situated in the very heart of Tanunda, The Jolly Folly is just two minutes stroll from the region’s best restaurants, bars, cafes and shops. This fabulously styled, self-contained guest wing is the perfect place to relax and explore everything the gorgeous Barossa Valley has to offer.

The space
The Jolly Folly is comprised of two private bedrooms, living room, bathroom and toilet. Entry is via the garden and through one of the separate entrance doors. A locked door separates the guest's wing from the host's house.

The bedrooms are calm and restful spaces perfect for a great night’s sleep. The super- comfortable beds are queen sized with quality linens and pillows. There is a desk in each room if you need to work. Drawer space and hanging rails are provided.

name: Home in Tanunda · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Welcome to our charming cottage in the heart of Tanunda Main Street, Barossa Valley. This recently renovated property has been beautifully restored and offers a comfortable and stylish stay in one of South Australia's most sought-after destinations.

Originally built in 1856, the cottage formed part of the original pharmacy in Tanunda. Today, it is a cozy two-bedroom retreat with all the modern amenities you need for a memorable stay.

The space
The first bedroom features a king and a single bed, while the second bedroom has a comfortable queen bed. In total, the property can sleep up to five guests.

The kitchen is equipped with a cooktop and a microwave convection oven, with cafes, restaurants, and wine bars mere steps from your front door. There is also air conditioning and heating throughout the property to keep you comfortable no matter the season.

Outside, the private courtyard offers a space to relax and unwind. There is outdo
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda is a town in the Barossa Valley region of South Australia, and it is known for its wineries and German heritage. name: Cottage in Kapunda · ★4.67 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
The cottage is an historic sandstone building, built in 1879.
The property is in a calm & tranquil location, set in 2.5 hectares of land, with views facing the reservoir in the 'Pine Reserves'. Originally built for the reservoir manager, the reservoir used to supply all the water to Australia's oldest mining town, Kapunda. Located in the Barossa Valley, 15 minute drive to the nearest winery, 45 mins to Clare Valley. Maggie Beer Farm shop 20 mins drive, golf course near, pool in town.

The space
The house is solid sandstone, with polished wooden floors. Updated with uber lux in mind, three rooms with queen beds. Each room has been designed for comfort and a good night’s sleep, whilst still retaining the original features.

The dramatic 4-metre-high ceilings are beautiful and keep the house really cool in summer. The front door opens on to the view of the ‘Pines Reserve’, the main eating /drinking table, is outside at the front of the house
neighborhood_overview: Kapunda is famous as the oldest mining town in Australia. The drive to Kapunda is beautiful, lots of little towns  to visit, there are cycling trails to explore,  a golf course,  trotting (horses) park. The Pines Reserve is great for walking and wildlife, echidnas, kangaroos, budgies, etc.   The town has the main essentials, and a great Foodland, for all necessary supplies.  Located between Clare Valley and Barossa it ideal for exploring both wine regions. ( You can hire affordable tour buses with drivers) .

name: Cottage in Lyndoch · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
description:
Welcome to Mrs Magpie's Cottage - a cosy nest enveloped in character and charm, situated in the beautiful Barossa Valley.

Perfect for a romantic escape, a family holiday or a girls' (or blokes') wine weekend.

Soak in the views of the surrounding hills as you enjoy a coffee or a glass of wine on the front porch. Sleeping up to five guests, Mrs Magpie's is the perfect base for you to explore the many wineries and charming historic towns in the Barossa Valley. Enjoy!

The space
Mrs Magpie's Cottage is in the heart of the quaint Barossa township of Lyndoch. Walking distance to the main street where you will find cafes, restaurants, supermarket, the Lyndoch Hotel, Ministry of Beer (brewery cellar door) and gift shops. Sitting on the front porch whilst enjoying a glass of complimentary local wine you have views of the surrounding hills, historic church and the old Barossa rail line.

Mrs Magpie's Cottage has three bedrooms sleeping five
neighborhood_overview:
Surrounded by vines dripping with grapes and rolling hills, the charming small town of Lyndoch is Mrs Magpie's home. Stroll to the local pub, The Lord Lyndoch boutique restaurant, The Ministry of Beer (Brewery Cellar Door), cafe and bakery. A country market in the town's institute is held on the second Saturday of each month featuring homemade goods and quirky treasures. Weave your way to Tanunda (only 10-15 minute drive away) past gorgeous vineyards and welcoming cellar doors.
Enjoy the peace and tranquillity of Lyndoch with everything the Barossa boasts at your fingertips.
host_about:
I love to laugh, eat potato chips, do yoga and write romance/mystery novels...not all at once of course! Though wouldn't that be hilarious! 

I am fastidiously clean but not OCD...potato chips are messy you know!!
And I value honesty and integrity above all else. 
Amy x

In the open garage there are table and chairs for meals and drinks.

Hi I'm Nigel, the owner and winemaker of Shrieking Witch Wines. Our tiny family business based in Gawler East the far south west Barossa. We have our Montepulciano vineyard, Chickens, vege garden and fruit trees there.
Our wines are all single vineyard-small batch high quality wines from the Barossa and Adelaide Hills. We know you'll love to stay at our 'winemakers quarters' and you can order ahead to have a bottle or two ready for your stay!

name: Home in Kapunda · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Experience the unhurried backcountry retreat at Horse Side Farm Stay! The ideal farm stay South Australia escape nestled in wide-open spaces, native birdlife, and farm animals (e.g., such as horses, sheep, and alpacas) to keep you company. An amazing piece of paradise, where you can take deep calming breaths and lazy afternoon naps in Kapunda. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: Please note that the tiny house is only a short distance from the main street, so you may hear passing vehicles on the property.

The space
Horse Side Farm Stay is located near Barossa Valley, Kapunda Tourist Park, and Whispering Wall are just a few of the attractions in the area. A comfortable off-grid accommodation with a well-equipped kitchenette (e.g., such as cooking tools, cutlery, and a portable electric cooler fridge), pot-bellied stove, a queen-sized bed up in the loft, and a couch on the ground floor.

The bathroom, however, follows ecologically sustainable principles, includi
neighborhood_overview:
Horse Side Farm Stay sits in a small town near Barossa Valley in South Australia. Where you can explore restaurants, shops, and attractions for you to enjoy. So, make an endless list of things to do.

Our local recommendations:

- Pizza Bar and Takeaway serves a diverse selection of ingredients for dine-in and takeaway pizzas in town.
- One White Kite is a cafe that offers a delicious selection of pastries, light meals, coffee, and tea in Kapunda.
- Kapunda Mine Trail is a popular attraction that marks the first commercially copper metal mine in Australia.
- Kapunda Tourist Park is a camping and cabin accommodation set in a well-shaded park in Dutton Park, Kapunda.
- Whispering Wall is a popular attraction where "whispered words" can be heard 140 meters away from the other end of the dam.

If you want to know more, you can check out "Things to Do near Kapunda."

name: Home in Nuriootpa · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
description:
Situated on a 13 hectare vineyard, this 4 bed home has reverse-cycle aircon and indoor and outdoor lounge areas. There’s a lovely garden with peach and lemon trees for you to pick in season. It’s 3 minutes drive to eateries and a supermarket, with a bigger selection at nearby Tanunda. Maggie Beer’s Farm shop is 2 minutes away offering a cafe, restaurant or cooking classes. Coullthard Reserve has family friendly picnic areas. And of course, there are endless wineries in the region to choose from.

The space
Arriving at the house, you’ll first see a covered patio with an outdoor table for 6 people in a relaxed country setting. You’ll then enter the house where to the left you’ll find a spacious lounge room with modern wood-look flooring, 2 x 2 seater sofas, a couple of occasional chairs, a Smart TV, an electric fireplace and a rug for winter comfort. A separate nook with bench seating is perfect for conversation or games. Ducted reverse-cycle aircon ensures year rou
neighborhood_overview: Located an hour’s drive from Adelaide, Nuriootpa is in the heart of the Barossa, famous for its world class wines and also home to some of the best culinary experiences in the region. It’s just a few minutes’ drive from the house to the town centre, where you can start your day with a coffee at the Fleur Social café before taking a stroll down the historic main street and exploring boutique shops. There’s a local Foodworks supermarket there too, or its less than 10 minutes’ drive to the Barossa Farmer’s Market in Angaston, open every Saturday morning. Indulge your sweet tooth at Linke's Bakery in Nuriootpa, or taste craft spirits infused with local botanicals at the Barossa Distilling Company’s rustic tasting room and bar. It’s also only a couple of minutes’ drive from the house to Maggie Beer’s Farm shop, where you can dine at The Eatery, purchase wines or take part in a cooking class. Coullthard Reserve is 5 minutes away by car, providing family friendly picnic areas, BBQ facilities,
host_about:
Hey I’m Mark!

After an extensive, colorful career performing on stage and in film/TV, I developed people skills which I love to utilize as a property host. People consider me to be a genuinely warm, polite and friendly person. 

I certainly love helping travelers enjoy their time here. My yardstick is treating
guests the way I like to be treated when I’m away from home. I work for MaisonNets, a boutique agency specializing in short-term rental management. The MaisonNets portfolio has over 125 properties, encompassing mid-range to luxury apartments and houses in Australia’s capital cities, as well as country homes and a villa in Bali. 

Our properties are all specifically selected for their amenities and prime location - the accommodation of choice for urban sophisticates, professionals, couples and families looking for a uniquely comfortable experience. 

With a focus on organic products, MaisonNets offers unparalleled personal service and attention to detail ensuring that you, our valued guest, have a wonderful stay with us.

name: Home in Tanunda · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
Our spacious property is designed for adults (couples & singles) and offers modern amenities, creating a comfortable and tranquil base for your Barossa adventures. Centrally located, you're just minutes away from some of the region's most celebrated wineries, fine dining restaurants, and boutique shops.

Enjoy a peaceful retreat where you can unwind after a day of exploring the valley's attractions. Enjoy a glass of local wine in your private outdoor space and relish in the serenity of the area.

The space
Welcome to our cosy slice of heaven right in the heart of the Barossa Valley! If you’re after an inviting spot that feels just like home, you’re come to the right place.

3 Bedrooms
- Master bedroom with Queen bed and ensuite.
- Second and third bedrooms with queen beds and shared bathroom.
- Ducted A/C through the home.
- Open plan with 2 living areas
- Dishwasher
- Washing Machine & Dryer.
Beds will be

name: Home in Tanunda · ★New · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
这处独具特色的房源有着自己独一无二的风格。

The space
Here is one of Barossa's earliest stone house, cozy in winter, cool in summer, super sturdy, and full of character. Here, you'll find three century-old Barossa trees and a family of lovely possums. They might come out at night and make some unexpected sounds, but they are harmless, gentle, and adorable little creatures, so there's no need to worry. There is an energy of love here that allows you to experience the history of 169 years.

Guest access
One bedroom with a comfy king-size bed,
A living room with couches,
A kitchen where you can prepare some simple dishes,
A 169-year-old wine cellar where you can enjoy wine with your loved ones,
A laundry room,
A bathroom,
A spa,
A backyard,
And a parking spot.

name: Villa in Angaston · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
description: Welcome to Benbullen Pavilions - a stylish and modern luxury accommodation option in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Pavilion One & Pavilion Two each feature 3 bedrooms with their own ensuites to accomodate up to 6 guests, with the option to be booked separately or together to accomodate for larger groups. Pavilion Two is also accessible. With superb views of the Barossa and surrounding natural landscape, you'll be sure to be met with a truly memorable stay in the most peaceful of settings.
neighborhood_overview: Centrally located between Tanunda and Angaston you will experience the true serenity of the Barossa Valley.
host_about: Janine currently runs her own beautiful 5 star reviewed bed and breakfast in the quaint village of Greenock along with managing the stunning Benbullen Retreat in the heart of The Barossa. Janine has passionately developed her work within tourism to a full-time capacity, gaining a reputable name as a high quality accommodation provider in the Barossa Valley. Janine will be your host during your stay at Benbullen Retreat and The Clyde, ensuring you have the most ultimate accommodation experience the Barossa has to offer.

name: Cabin in Tanunda · ★New · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
description: 在这处独特而宁静的度假胜地放松身心。
host_about:
Hello ,

We are a family who have been running Airbnb’s since 2017. We love it and are very interested to expand it.

Aloe has just published her first book on the accommodation businesses. Aloe has published numerous other books on various topics and always loves to make our guests happy.

Aloe’s partner Nick is a saxophonist who has worked as a professional Musican for 25 years and now helps to manage our Airbnb’s as well.  Nick can be a bit talkative.

Sherry is an accountant and works on financial and cleaning projects.  She will be very helpful if you need anything.

Sherry’s partner works on maintenance projects and he also is  a good cook. He has a warm kind soul.

Lia is our cleaner and she loves her job very much!

Lia’s partner Jack is taking care of the properties and helping Sarah to get the cleaning done.

We all love to be hosts and we use Airbnb all the time when we’re traveling.

Nice to meet you here!

name: Home in Nuriootpa · ★New · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
description:
Open, airy, and filled with natural light, “Kroemer House” sits nestled only a stone's throw from the thriving heart of the Barossa Valley, Nurioopta - making it the perfect home away from home to base yourself while exploring the award-winning winery region.

The space
Inside, you are met with beautiful and considered details and decor, and outside you'll find a sun-drenched yard and ample space for the kids.

Perfectly placed, a cruisy 5-minute stroll from all the main street has to offer; cafes, restaurants, bars and shopping. Plus, some of the area's most iconic wineries are on your doorstep, don’t miss a visit to Penfolds, First Drop Wines or Outlaw Wines.

Sleeping 8, there's enough space to bring your whole family or share the home with friends for a couples trip of a lifetime. Boasting delightfully soft, luxury linens, high-speed internet and a fully equipped kitchen, coffee machine and all, you’ll have all you need right here in Kroe
